        • {
          • "name": "Layer 1",
          • "ocgId": 86
          },
        • {
          • "name": "Layer 2",
          • "ocgId": 72
          }
        ],
      • "name": "Grouped layers"
      }
    ]
}

Copy a Document

You can use this endpoint to copy the document, without having to reupload it to Document Engine

The copy includes the latest version of all layers and their annotations from the original document.

A common use case for copying a document is to create an individual document for each user, allowing different users work on the same file without seeing each other's annotations. However, we recommend leveraging named Instant Layers for such scenarios as they provide more efficient API to manage different document versions.

Request Body schema: application/json
document_id
string

The ID of the original document.

new_document_id
string

The ID of the copy.

DocumentStorageConfiguration (object) or DocumentStorageConfiguration (object) or DocumentStorageConfiguration (object)

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
document_id
required
string

The ID of the newly created document.

/api/copy_document

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "document_id": "7KPSA689RP53HB64GKKZX64XFV",
  • "new_document_id": "7KPS5BP7NVPZPFTEMN2PB6D3XY",
  • "storage": {
    • "backend": "s3",
    • "bucketName": "string",
    • "bucketRegion": "string"
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "document_id": "7KPS5BP7NVPZPFTEMN2PB6D3XY"
    }
}

Document Editing

Process documents.

Process Documents And Download the Result

This endpoint allows to use Build instructions to process a document. This allows to assemble a PDF from multiple parts, such as an existing document in supported content type, a blank page, or an HTML page. You can apply one or more actions, such as watermarking, rotating pages, or importing annotations. Once the entire PDF is generated from its parts, you can also apply additional actions, such as optical character recognition (OCR), to the assembled PDF itself.

Request Body schema:
required
Array of FilePart (object) or HTMLPart (object) or NewPagePart (object) or DocumentPart (object)

Parts of the document to be built.

Multiple types of parts are supported:

  • FilePart that represents a binary input file that can be either a part name in the multipart/form-data request or an URL of a remote file.
  • HTMLPart that represents an HTML input file along with it's assets.
  • NewPagePart that represents a document with empty pages.
  • DocumentPart that represents a document (with optional layer) managed by Nutrient Document Engine. Only applicable if used in a Document Engine context.
Array of ApplyInstantJsonAction (object) or ApplyXfdfAction (object) or FlattenAction (object) or OcrAction (object) or RotateAction (object) or (WatermarkAction (Text (object) or Image (object))) or (CreateRedactionsAction (Preset (object) or Regex (object) or Text (object))) or ApplyRedactionsAction (object)

Actions to be performed on the document after it is built.

PDFOutput (object) or PDFAOutput (object) or PDFUAOutput (object) or ImageOutput (object) or JSONContentOutput (object) or OfficeOutput (object) or HTMLOutput (object) or MarkdownOutput (object)

Responses

Response Schema:
string <binary>

The processed PDF file. Returned in case of pdf, pdfa and pdfua output types.

/api/build

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
{
  • "parts": [
    • {
      • "file": "pdf-file-from-multipart"
      }
    ],
  • "actions": [
    • {
      • "type": "applyInstantJson",
      • "file": {
        • "url": "https://remote-file-storage/input-file",
        • "sha256": "string"
        }
      }
    ],
  • "output": {
    • "metadata": {
      • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification",
      • "author": "Document Author"
      },
    • "labels": [
      • {
        • "pages": [
          • [
            • 0
            ]
          ],
        • "label": "Page I-III"
        }
      ],
    • "user_password": "string",
    • "owner_password": "string",
    • "user_permissions": [
      • "printing"
      ],
    • "optimize": {
      • "grayscaleText": false,
      • "grayscaleGraphics": false,
      • "grayscaleImages": false,
      • "grayscaleFormFields": false,
      • "grayscaleAnnotations": false,
      • "disableImages": false,
      • "mrcCompression": false,
      • "imageOptimizationQuality": 2,
      • "linearize": false
      },
    • "type": "pdf"
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 400
  • 422
Content type
No sample

Process Office Template And Download the Result

This endpoint allows to populate the document template (in DOCX format) with corresponding data.

Request Body schema: multipart/form-data
object
document
string <binary>

The binary content of the document to process.

Responses

Response Schema: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document
string <binary>

The processed document in DOCX format.

/api/process_office_template

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/process_office_template \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --form 'model={"config":{"delimiter":{"start":"{{","end":"}}"}},"model":{"placeholder":"replacement value","loop-name":[{"placeholder-within-loop":"replacement value","another-placeholder-within-loop":"replacement value 2"},{"placeholder-within-loop":"another replacement value","another-placeholder-within-loop":"another replacement value 2"}]}}' \
  --form 'document=<DOCX data>'

Response samples

  • 400
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "The request is malformed",
  • "status": 400,
  • "requestId": "xy123zzdafaf",
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ]
}

Process Documents And Persist the Result

This endpoint allows to use Build instructions to process a document.

The current document can be referred to by using #self anchor.

{
  "document": { "id": "#self" }
}

The result of the processing will replace the document's base layer after successful completion.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required
Array of FilePart (object) or HTMLPart (object) or NewPagePart (object) or DocumentPart (object)

Parts of the document to be built.

Multiple types of parts are supported:

  • FilePart that represents a binary input file that can be either a part name in the multipart/form-data request or an URL of a remote file.
  • HTMLPart that represents an HTML input file along with it's assets.
  • NewPagePart that represents a document with empty pages.
  • DocumentPart that represents a document (with optional layer) managed by Nutrient Document Engine. Only applicable if used in a Document Engine context.
Array of ApplyInstantJsonAction (object) or ApplyXfdfAction (object) or FlattenAction (object) or OcrAction (object) or RotateAction (object) or (WatermarkAction (Text (object) or Image (object))) or (CreateRedactionsAction (Preset (object) or Regex (object) or Text (object))) or ApplyRedactionsAction (object)

Actions to be performed on the document after it is built.

PDFOutput (object) or PDFAOutput (object) or PDFUAOutput (object) or ImageOutput (object) or JSONContentOutput (object) or OfficeOutput (object) or HTMLOutput (object) or MarkdownOutput (object)

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
passwordProtected
required
boolean

Indicates whether the document is password protected.

sourcePdfSha256
required
string

SHA256 hash of the PDF file underlying the document.

title
required
string or null

The document title.

byteSize
required
integer >= 1

The size of the document in bytes.

createdAt
required
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

object

Information about the assert storage for the underlying PDF file.

/api/documents/{documentId}/apply_instructions

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
{
  • "parts": [
    • {
      • "file": "pdf-file-from-multipart"
      }
    ],
  • "actions": [
    • {
      • "type": "applyInstantJson",
      • "file": {
        • "url": "https://remote-file-storage/input-file",
        • "sha256": "string"
        }
      }
    ],
  • "output": {
    • "metadata": {
      • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification",
      • "author": "Document Author"
      },
    • "labels": [
      • {
        • "pages": [
          • [
            • 0
            ]
          ],
        • "label": "Page I-III"
        }
      ],
    • "user_password": "string",
    • "owner_password": "string",
    • "user_permissions": [
      • "printing"
      ],
    • "optimize": {
      • "grayscaleText": false,
      • "grayscaleGraphics": false,
      • "grayscaleImages": false,
      • "grayscaleFormFields": false,
      • "grayscaleAnnotations": false,
      • "disableImages": false,
      • "mrcCompression": false,
      • "imageOptimizationQuality": 2,
      • "linearize": false
      },
    • "type": "pdf"
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "passwordProtected": true,
    • "sourcePdfSha256": "1defd934dbbf77587eb9b7f45d162d2a3aea16c840a9e7cfa190fb2ea1f40a76",
    • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification",
    • "byteSize": 192000,
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "storage": {
      • "type": "built-in",
      • "bucket": "string",
      • "url": "string"
      }
    }
}

Edit the Document and Persist the Result Deprecated

⚠️ This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /api/documents/{documentId}/apply_instructions instead.

This endpoint allows you to edit the document, performing transformations like rotating, adding or deleting pages, and store the resulting PDF file at the document's base layer.

Editing the document affects the responses returned by other endpoints. For example, removing a page also deletes all the annotations on that page. Similarly, other functionality, like searching in a document will return different results.

If you need to preserve the original document, PDF file, and related data, we recommend leveraging Instant Layers and always using named layers.

Note that in order to use this endpoint you need to have a document editing feature enabled in your license.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
Array of Add page (after) (object) or Add page (before) (object) or Duplicate pages (object) or Move pages (after) (object) or Move pages (before) (object) or Rotate pages (object) or Keep pages (object) or Remove pages (object) or Set page label (object) or Apply XFDF (object) or Apply Instant JSON (object) or OCR (object) or Flatten Annotations (object) or Update metadata (object) or Apply redactions (object)

An array of operations which can be applied to the document.

Array
One of
required
Page index (integer) or First page (string) or Last page (string)
backgroundColor
required
string^#[0-9a-fA-F]{6}$

A background color that will fill the page.

pageWidth
required
number

Page width in points.

pageHeight
required
number

Page height in points.

rotateBy
required
integer
Enum: 0 90 180 270

Clockwise rotation of the page.

type
required
string
Value: "addPage"
insets
Array of numbers = 4 items

Insets of the page in a form [left, top, width, height].

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
passwordProtected
required
boolean

Indicates whether the document is password protected.

sourcePdfSha256
required
string

SHA256 hash of the PDF file underlying the document.

title
required
string or null

The document title.

byteSize
required
integer >= 1

The size of the document in bytes.

createdAt
required
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

object

Information about the assert storage for the underlying PDF file.

/api/documents/{documentId}/apply_operations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "operations": [
    • {
      • "type": "rotatePages",
      • "pageIndexes": [
        • 0
        ],
      • "rotateBy": 90
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "passwordProtected": true,
    • "sourcePdfSha256": "1defd934dbbf77587eb9b7f45d162d2a3aea16c840a9e7cfa190fb2ea1f40a76",
    • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification",
    • "byteSize": 192000,
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "storage": {
      • "type": "built-in",
      • "bucket": "string",
      • "url": "string"
      }
    }
}

Edit the Document and Download it Deprecated

⚠️ This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /api/build instead.

This endpoint allows you to edit the document, performing transformations like rotating, adding or deleting pages. After these operations are applied, the Document Engine will return the result as a PDF file.

Note that in order to use this endpoint you need to have a document editing feature enabled in your license.

Operations with external files

In order to use importDocument, applyInstantJson, or applyXfdf operations, you need to use multipart/form-data content type.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
Array of Add page (after) (object) or Add page (before) (object) or Duplicate pages (object) or Move pages (after) (object) or Move pages (before) (object) or Rotate pages (object) or Keep pages (object) or Remove pages (object) or Set page label (object) or Apply XFDF (object) or Apply Instant JSON (object) or OCR (object) or Flatten Annotations (object) or Update metadata (object) or Apply redactions (object)

An array of operations which can be applied to the document.

Array
One of
required
Page index (integer) or First page (string) or Last page (string)
backgroundColor
required
string^#[0-9a-fA-F]{6}$

A background color that will fill the page.

pageWidth
required
number

Page width in points.

pageHeight
required
number

Page height in points.

rotateBy
required
integer
Enum: 0 90 180 270

Clockwise rotation of the page.

type
required
string
Value: "addPage"
insets
Array of numbers = 4 items

Insets of the page in a form [left, top, width, height].

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/pdf_with_operations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "operations": [
    • {
      • "type": "rotatePages",
      • "pageIndexes": [
        • 0
        ],
      • "rotateBy": 90
      }
    ]
}

Import and Export

Import and export information from documents.

Download the Document as a PDF

This operation downloads the latest version of the document with annotations as a PDF file.

If the query parameter source=true is included in the request, the originally uploaded version will be fetched instead.

Additionally, you can download the flattened version of the file by providing flatten=true query parameter. Note, however, that source and flatten can't be used at the same time.

To download a PDF/A conformant document, include the type=pdfa query parameter. You can also specify the conformance of the PDF/A file by specifying the conformance=pdfa-1a query parameter.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

query Parameters
type
string
Default: "pdf"
Enum: "pdf" "pdfa"

Use this option to determine the format of the downloaded PDF file

source
boolean

If set to true, the originally uploaded version of the PDF file will be fetched. The remaining properties are mutually exclusive with this property.

flatten
boolean

Determines whether a flattened version of the PDF file will be downloaded. If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its annotations burned into the document and will have no annotations.

render_ap_streams
boolean

If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its custom AP streams rendered into the document.

annotations
boolean

If set to true, annotations will be included in the downloaded file.

comments
boolean

If set to true, comments will be included in the downloaded file.

object

If set, the resulting PDF file will be optimized according to the provided options.

conformance
string
Enum: "pdfa-1a" "pdfa-1b" "pdfa-2a" "pdfa-2u" "pdfa-2b" "pdfa-3a" "pdfa-3u"

Specify the conformance level of the PDF/A file. Requires the type parameter to be present and equal to pdfa.

keep_signatures
boolean

If set to false, the signatures and form fields will get flattened in the resulting PDF. Defaults to true.

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/pdf

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url 'http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/pdf?type={string_value}&source={boolean_value}&flatten={boolean_value}&render_ap_streams={boolean_value}&annotations={boolean_value}&comments={boolean_value}&optimize=SOME_OBJECT_VALUE&conformance={string_value}&keep_signatures={boolean_value}' \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Download the Document as a PDF

This operation downloads the latest version of the document as a PDF file.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
type
required
string
Enum: "pdf" "pdfa"

The type of output file. Can be pdfa or pdf.

source
boolean

If set to true, the originally uploaded version of the PDF file will be fetched. The remaining properties are mutually exclusive with this property.

flatten
boolean

Determines whether a flattened version of the PDF file will be downloaded. If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its annotations burned into the document and will have no annotations.

render_ap_streams
boolean

If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its custom AP streams rendered into the document.

annotations
boolean

If set to true, annotations will be included in the downloaded file

comments
boolean

If set to true, comments will be included in the downloaded file.

keep_signatures
boolean
Default: true

If set to false, signatures and form fields will get flattened in the resulting PDF. Defaults to true.

conformance
string
Default: "pdfa-1b"
Enum: "pdfa-1a" "pdfa-1b" "pdfa-2a" "pdfa-2u" "pdfa-2b" "pdfa-3a" "pdfa-3u"

The level of conformance of the pdfa file. Defaults to pdfa-1b if the type is set to pdfa and conformance is not explicitly specified.

object

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/pdf

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "type": "pdfa",
  • "source": true,
  • "flatten": true,
  • "render_ap_streams": true,
  • "annotations": true,
  • "comments": true,
  • "keep_signatures": true,
  • "conformance": "pdfa-1a",
  • "optimize": {
    • "grayscaleText": false,
    • "grayscaleGraphics": false,
    • "grayscaleImages": false,
    • "grayscaleFormFields": false,
    • "grayscaleAnnotations": false,
    • "disableImages": false,
    • "mrcCompression": false,
    • "imageOptimizationQuality": 2,
    • "linearize": false
    }
}

Export Annotations as an XFDF

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/vnd.adobe.xfdf
string
/api/documents/{documentId}/document.xfdf

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/document.xfdf \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Export Records as an Instant JSON

Use this endpoint to export a document's records as an Instant JSON file. This includes annotations, form field, form field values and bookmarks.

This API allows to optionally specify the Instant JSON schema version for the annotations, controlled via annotation_version query parameter. The value of annotation_version can be any valid positive integer version. If the annotation_version parameter is not mentioned, or is invalid, the latest version of Instant JSON schema will be exported.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

query Parameters
annotation_version
integer
Enum: 1 2

The version of Instant JSON schema that should be exported for annotations.

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

/api/documents/{documentId}/document.json

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url 'http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/document.json?annotation_version=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE' \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "format": "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1",
  • "annotations": [
    • {
      • "v": 2,
      • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
      • "pageIndex": 0,
      • "bbox": [
        • 255.10077620466092,
        • 656.7566095695641,
        • 145.91672653256705,
        • 18.390804597701162
        ],
      • "action": {
        • "type": "goTo",
        • "pageIndex": 0
        },
      • "opacity": 1,
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "flags": [
        • "noPrint"
        ],
      • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "name": "string",
      • "creatorName": "string",
      • "customData": {
        • "foo": "bar"
        },
      • "rects": [
        • [
          • 100,
          • 200,
          • 300,
          • 400
          ]
        ],
      • "blendMode": "normal",
      • "color": "#fcee7c",
      • "note": "This is a note.",
      • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
      }
    ],
  • "attachments": {
    • "388dd55f16b0b7ccdf7abdc7a0daea7872ef521de56ee820b4440e52c87d081b": {
      • "binary": "YXR0YWNobWVudCBjb250ZW50cwo=",
      • "contentType": "image/png"
      },
    • "ccbb4499fa6d9f003545fa43ec19511fdb7227ca505bba9f74d787dff57af77b": {
      • "binary": "YW5vdGhlciBhdHRhY2htZW50IGNvbnRlbnRzCg==",
      • "contentType": "plain/text"
      }
    },
  • "formFields": [
    • {
      • "v": 1,
      • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
      • "name": "Form-Field",
      • "label": "Form Field",
      • "annotationIds": [
        • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
        ],
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "flags": [
        • "required"
        ],
      • "buttonLabel": "string"
      }
    ],
  • "formFieldValues": [
    • {
      • "name": "string",
      • "value": "string",
      • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field-value",
      • "v": 1,
      • "optionIndexes": [
        • 0
        ],
      • "isFitting": false
      }
    ],
  • "bookmarks": [
    • {
      • "name": "string",
      • "type": "pspdfkit/bookmark",
      • "v": 1,
      • "action": {
        • "type": "goTo",
        • "pageIndex": 0
        },
      • "pdfBookmarkId": "string"
      }
    ],
  • "comments": [
    • {
      • "type": "pspdfkit/comment",
      • "pageIndex": 0,
      • "rootId": "01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG",
      • "text": {
        • "format": "xhtml",
        • "value": "Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."
        },
      • "v": 2,
      • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "creatorName": "John Doe",
      • "customData": { },
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"
      }
    ],
  • "skippedPdfObjectIds": [
    • 0
    ],
  • "pdfId": {
    • "permanent": "9C3nLxNzQBuBBzv96LbdMg==",
    • "changing": "Oi+XccZpDHChV7I="
    }
}

Apply an Instant JSON to Document

To import an Instant JSON file and apply it to an existing document, you can POST a multipart/form request including an instant.json file. This will modify the default layer of the document in place. In case of success, the endpoint will respond with an empty JSON object.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: multipart/form-data
object

Instant JSON is a format for bringing annotations and bookmarks into a modern format while keeping all important properties to make the Instant JSON spec work with PDF.

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/apply_instant_json

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/apply_instant_json \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password' \
  --form 'instant.json={"format":"https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1","annotations":[{"v":2,"type":"pspdfkit/markup/highlight","pageIndex":0,"bbox":[255.10077620466092,656.7566095695641,145.91672653256705,18.390804597701162],"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"opacity":1,"pdfObjectId":0,"id":"01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","flags":["noPrint"],"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","name":"string","creatorName":"string","customData":{"foo":"bar"},"rects":[[100,200,300,400]],"blendMode":"normal","color":"#fcee7c","note":"This is a note.","isCommentThreadRoot":true}],"attachments":{"388dd55f16b0b7ccdf7abdc7a0daea7872ef521de56ee820b4440e52c87d081b":{"binary":"YXR0YWNobWVudCBjb250ZW50cwo=","contentType":"image/png"},"ccbb4499fa6d9f003545fa43ec19511fdb7227ca505bba9f74d787dff57af77b":{"binary":"YW5vdGhlciBhdHRhY2htZW50IGNvbnRlbnRzCg==","contentType":"plain/text"}},"formFields":[{"v":1,"type":"pspdfkit/form-field/button","id":"7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ","name":"Form-Field","label":"Form Field","annotationIds":["01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"],"pdfObjectId":0,"flags":["required"],"buttonLabel":"string"}],"formFieldValues":[{"name":"string","value":"string","type":"pspdfkit/form-field-value","v":1,"optionIndexes":[0],"isFitting":false}],"bookmarks":[{"name":"string","type":"pspdfkit/bookmark","v":1,"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"pdfBookmarkId":"string"}],"comments":[{"type":"pspdfkit/comment","pageIndex":0,"rootId":"01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG","text":{"format":"xhtml","value":"Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."},"v":2,"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","creatorName":"John Doe","customData":{},"pdfObjectId":0,"updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"}],"skippedPdfObjectIds":[0],"pdfId":{"permanent":"9C3nLxNzQBuBBzv96LbdMg==","changing":"Oi+XccZpDHChV7I="}}'

Download a Document with Instant JSON

To import an Instant JSON file and download the resulting PDF, you can POST a multipart/form request including an instant.json file.

This will create a new PDF containing the latest annotations of the chosen layer, import the uploaded Instant JSON, and respond with the resulting PDF. Please note that this action will not modify the existing document, but rather only import the Instant JSON on a temporary file that will be downloaded in the process.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: multipart/form-data
object

Instant JSON is a format for bringing annotations and bookmarks into a modern format while keeping all important properties to make the Instant JSON spec work with PDF.

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/pdf_with_instant_json

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/pdf_with_instant_json \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password' \
  --form 'instant.json={"format":"https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1","annotations":[{"v":2,"type":"pspdfkit/markup/highlight","pageIndex":0,"bbox":[255.10077620466092,656.7566095695641,145.91672653256705,18.390804597701162],"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"opacity":1,"pdfObjectId":0,"id":"01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","flags":["noPrint"],"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","name":"string","creatorName":"string","customData":{"foo":"bar"},"rects":[[100,200,300,400]],"blendMode":"normal","color":"#fcee7c","note":"This is a note.","isCommentThreadRoot":true}],"attachments":{"388dd55f16b0b7ccdf7abdc7a0daea7872ef521de56ee820b4440e52c87d081b":{"binary":"YXR0YWNobWVudCBjb250ZW50cwo=","contentType":"image/png"},"ccbb4499fa6d9f003545fa43ec19511fdb7227ca505bba9f74d787dff57af77b":{"binary":"YW5vdGhlciBhdHRhY2htZW50IGNvbnRlbnRzCg==","contentType":"plain/text"}},"formFields":[{"v":1,"type":"pspdfkit/form-field/button","id":"7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ","name":"Form-Field","label":"Form Field","annotationIds":["01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"],"pdfObjectId":0,"flags":["required"],"buttonLabel":"string"}],"formFieldValues":[{"name":"string","value":"string","type":"pspdfkit/form-field-value","v":1,"optionIndexes":[0],"isFitting":false}],"bookmarks":[{"name":"string","type":"pspdfkit/bookmark","v":1,"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"pdfBookmarkId":"string"}],"comments":[{"type":"pspdfkit/comment","pageIndex":0,"rootId":"01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG","text":{"format":"xhtml","value":"Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."},"v":2,"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","creatorName":"John Doe","customData":{},"pdfObjectId":0,"updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"}],"skippedPdfObjectIds":[0],"pdfId":{"permanent":"9C3nLxNzQBuBBzv96LbdMg==","changing":"Oi+XccZpDHChV7I="}}'

Copy a Default Layer With Instant JSON

This will create a new PDF containing the latest annotations of the default/base layer, optionally import the uploaded Instant JSON, and persist the resulting PDF as a new document.

If the content type of the request is multipart/form-data, the document with its default layer will be copied, and uploaded instant.json file will be imported into the default layer.

If the content type is application/json, the request body is ignored and the document is copied as-is, without any modifications to the default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
object

Instant JSON is a format for bringing annotations and bookmarks into a modern format while keeping all important properties to make the Instant JSON spec work with PDF.

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
createdAt
required
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

documentId
required
string

The ID of the document.

required
Array of objects

An array of errors encountered during the operation.

password_protected
required
boolean

Indicates whether the document is password protected.

sourcePdfSha256
required
string

SHA256 hash of the PDF file underlying the document.

title
required
string or null

The document title.

/api/documents/{documentId}/copy_with_instant_json

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
No sample

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
  • "documentId": "7KPZW8XFGM4F1C92KWBK1B748M",
  • "errors": [
    • {
      • "reason": "string"
      }
    ],
  • "password_protected": true,
  • "sourcePdfSha256": "1defd934dbbf77587eb9b7f45d162d2a3aea16c840a9e7cfa190fb2ea1f40a76",
  • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification"
}

Layers

Instant Layers are a capability of Nutrient Document Engine that allows you to manage multiple versions of a document while uploading it only once.

When uploading a document, the content of the document (that is, all annotations and values entered into form fields) is extracted into an immutable base layer. When synchronizing changes via Nutrient Instant or by using the API, you can now specify the layer name by setting the "layer" claim in the JSON Web Token (JWT) or by using our layer endpoints. A layer mirrors the original content of a document (i.e. the content of the base layer) until the first change is made to its content. This means that layers don’t have to be manually created, but rather are created for you as soon you make the first changes, at which point the base layer’s content is copied into the layer and your changes are applied.

If you need only one version of a document or don’t want to use layers, you can just omit the "layer" claim and use the annotation endpoints. In this case, all changes are persisted to the default layer with an empty name.

Layer names are not allowed to contain the * character, and their maximum allowed length is 256 characters.

Get Document's Layers

Fetches a list of document's layers.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
data
Array of strings
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": [
    • "my-layer"
    ]
}

Create a New Layer

This endpoint allows you to create a new layer for a document. It supports three modes of operation:

  • create a new layer based on a source layer: this essentially copies a layer in a document to a new layer in the same document
  • create a new layer based on an Instant JSON file: this creates a new layer by copying document's base layer and applying the provided Instant JSON payload
  • create a new layer based on a source layer and an Instant JSON file: the same as above, but instead of copying the base layer, the source layer is used

NOTE: When the provided source layer name doesn't exist, the base layer is used instead.

In case of success, the new layer name is returned along with a list of errors from importing the Instant JSON file into the layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
name
required
string

The name of the new layer.

source_layer_name
string

The name of the layer the new one will be based on. If not provided or the layer with the given name doesn't exist, the base layer is assumed instead.

Responses

Response Schema:
object
name
required
string

The name of the newly created layer.

required
Array of objects

An array of errors encountered during the operation.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
{
  • "name": "my-layer",
  • "source_layer_name": "my-existing-layer"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
{
  • "data": {
    • "name": "my-layer",
    • "errors": [
      • {
        • "reason": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
}

This endpoint allows you to delete a layer along with all of its contents.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request DELETE \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Download the Layer as a PDF

This operation downloads the latest version of the document with annotations for the specified layer as a PDF file.

For example, you can use this endpoint to download the PDF file generated after applying a series of document operations on a given layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

query Parameters
type
string
Default: "pdf"
Enum: "pdf" "pdfa"

Use this option to determine the format of the downloaded PDF file

source
boolean

If set to true, the originally uploaded version of the PDF file will be fetched. The remaining properties are mutually exclusive with this property.

flatten
boolean

Determines whether a flattened version of the PDF file will be downloaded. If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its annotations burned into the document and will have no annotations.

render_ap_streams
boolean

If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its custom AP streams rendered into the document.

annotations
boolean

If set to true, annotations will be included in the downloaded file.

comments
boolean

If set to true, comments will be included in the downloaded file.

object

If set, the resulting PDF file will be optimized according to the provided options.

conformance
string
Enum: "pdfa-1a" "pdfa-1b" "pdfa-2a" "pdfa-2u" "pdfa-2b" "pdfa-3a" "pdfa-3u"

Specify the conformance level of the PDF/A file. Requires the type parameter to be present and equal to pdfa.

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pdf

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url 'http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pdf?type={string_value}&source={boolean_value}&flatten={boolean_value}&render_ap_streams={boolean_value}&annotations={boolean_value}&comments={boolean_value}&optimize=SOME_OBJECT_VALUE&conformance={string_value}' \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Download the Layer as a PDF

This operation downloads the latest version of the document with annotations as a PDF file.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
type
required
string
Enum: "pdf" "pdfa"

The type of output file. Can be pdfa or pdf.

source
boolean

If set to true, the originally uploaded version of the PDF file will be fetched. The remaining properties are mutually exclusive with this property.

flatten
boolean

Determines whether a flattened version of the PDF file will be downloaded. If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its annotations burned into the document and will have no annotations.

render_ap_streams
boolean

If set to true, the resulting PDF file will have its custom AP streams rendered into the document.

annotations
boolean

If set to true, annotations will be included in the downloaded file

comments
boolean

If set to true, comments will be included in the downloaded file.

conformance
string
Default: "pdfa-1b"
Enum: "pdfa-1a" "pdfa-1b" "pdfa-2a" "pdfa-2u" "pdfa-2b" "pdfa-3a" "pdfa-3u"

The level of conformance of the pdfa file. Defaults to pdfa-1b if the type is set to pdfa and conformance is not explicitly specified.

object

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pdf

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "type": "pdfa",
  • "source": true,
  • "flatten": true,
  • "render_ap_streams": true,
  • "annotations": true,
  • "comments": true,
  • "conformance": "pdfa-1a",
  • "optimize": {
    • "grayscaleText": false,
    • "grayscaleGraphics": false,
    • "grayscaleImages": false,
    • "grayscaleFormFields": false,
    • "grayscaleAnnotations": false,
    • "disableImages": false,
    • "mrcCompression": false,
    • "imageOptimizationQuality": 2,
    • "linearize": false
    }
}

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"

object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects

Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

    • "changing": "Oi+XccZpDHChV7I="
    }

Fetch Document Layer Information

This endpoint allows you to fetch the page count, the dimensions of each page, and the document's permissions.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
pageCount
required
integer >= 1

The number of pages of the document.

hasXFA
boolean

Are XFA forms present in the document?

object
Array of objects
object

The document's permission.

title
string or null

The document title.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/document_info

  • Java
  • C#
  • Python

  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/document_info \

  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

      • "creator": "string",

      • "dateModified": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"

        • "height": 842,
