Apply an Instant JSON to a Layer

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: multipart/form-data
object

Instant JSON is a format for bringing annotations and bookmarks into a modern format while keeping all important properties to make the Instant JSON spec work with PDF.

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/apply_instant_json

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/apply_instant_json \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password' \
  --form 'instant.json={"format":"https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1","annotations":[{"v":2,"type":"pspdfkit/markup/highlight","pageIndex":0,"bbox":[255.10077620466092,656.7566095695641,145.91672653256705,18.390804597701162],"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"opacity":1,"pdfObjectId":0,"id":"01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","flags":["noPrint"],"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","name":"string","creatorName":"string","customData":{"foo":"bar"},"rects":[[100,200,300,400]],"blendMode":"normal","color":"#fcee7c","note":"This is a note.","isCommentThreadRoot":true}],"attachments":{"388dd55f16b0b7ccdf7abdc7a0daea7872ef521de56ee820b4440e52c87d081b":{"binary":"YXR0YWNobWVudCBjb250ZW50cwo=","contentType":"image/png"},"ccbb4499fa6d9f003545fa43ec19511fdb7227ca505bba9f74d787dff57af77b":{"binary":"YW5vdGhlciBhdHRhY2htZW50IGNvbnRlbnRzCg==","contentType":"plain/text"}},"formFields":[{"v":1,"type":"pspdfkit/form-field/button","id":"7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ","name":"Form-Field","label":"Form Field","annotationIds":["01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"],"pdfObjectId":0,"flags":["required"],"buttonLabel":"string"}],"formFieldValues":[{"name":"string","value":"string","type":"pspdfkit/form-field-value","v":1,"optionIndexes":[0],"isFitting":false}],"bookmarks":[{"name":"string","type":"pspdfkit/bookmark","v":1,"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"pdfBookmarkId":"string"}],"comments":[{"type":"pspdfkit/comment","pageIndex":0,"rootId":"01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG","text":{"format":"xhtml","value":"Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."},"v":2,"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","creatorName":"John Doe","customData":{},"pdfObjectId":0,"updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"}],"skippedPdfObjectIds":[0],"pdfId":{"permanent":"9C3nLxNzQBuBBzv96LbdMg==","changing":"Oi+XccZpDHChV7I="}}'

Download a PDF, Applying the Instant JSON to a Layer

To import an Instant JSON file and download the resulting PDF, you can POST a multipart/form request including an instant.json file.

This will create a new PDF containing the latest annotations of the default layer, import the uploaded Instant JSON, and respond with the resulting PDF. Please note that this action will not modify the existing document, but rather only import the Instant JSON on a temporary file that will be downloaded in the process.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: multipart/form-data
object

Instant JSON is a format for bringing annotations and bookmarks into a modern format while keeping all important properties to make the Instant JSON spec work with PDF.

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pdf_with_instant_json

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pdf_with_instant_json \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password' \
  --form 'instant.json={"format":"https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1","annotations":[{"v":2,"type":"pspdfkit/markup/highlight","pageIndex":0,"bbox":[255.10077620466092,656.7566095695641,145.91672653256705,18.390804597701162],"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"opacity":1,"pdfObjectId":0,"id":"01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","flags":["noPrint"],"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","name":"string","creatorName":"string","customData":{"foo":"bar"},"rects":[[100,200,300,400]],"blendMode":"normal","color":"#fcee7c","note":"This is a note.","isCommentThreadRoot":true}],"attachments":{"388dd55f16b0b7ccdf7abdc7a0daea7872ef521de56ee820b4440e52c87d081b":{"binary":"YXR0YWNobWVudCBjb250ZW50cwo=","contentType":"image/png"},"ccbb4499fa6d9f003545fa43ec19511fdb7227ca505bba9f74d787dff57af77b":{"binary":"YW5vdGhlciBhdHRhY2htZW50IGNvbnRlbnRzCg==","contentType":"plain/text"}},"formFields":[{"v":1,"type":"pspdfkit/form-field/button","id":"7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ","name":"Form-Field","label":"Form Field","annotationIds":["01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ","7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"],"pdfObjectId":0,"flags":["required"],"buttonLabel":"string"}],"formFieldValues":[{"name":"string","value":"string","type":"pspdfkit/form-field-value","v":1,"optionIndexes":[0],"isFitting":false}],"bookmarks":[{"name":"string","type":"pspdfkit/bookmark","v":1,"action":{"type":"goTo","pageIndex":0},"pdfBookmarkId":"string"}],"comments":[{"type":"pspdfkit/comment","pageIndex":0,"rootId":"01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG","text":{"format":"xhtml","value":"Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."},"v":2,"createdAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z","creatorName":"John Doe","customData":{},"pdfObjectId":0,"updatedAt":"2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"}],"skippedPdfObjectIds":[0],"pdfId":{"permanent":"9C3nLxNzQBuBBzv96LbdMg==","changing":"Oi+XccZpDHChV7I="}}'

Copy the Layer Into a New Document, Applying the Instant JSON

If the content type of the request is multipart/form-data, the document with the chosen layer will be copied, and the uploaded instant.json file will be imported into the default layer.

If the content type is application/json, the request body is ignored and the layer is copied as-is, without any modifications to the default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
object

Instant JSON is a format for bringing annotations and bookmarks into a modern format while keeping all important properties to make the Instant JSON spec work with PDF.

format
required
string
Value: "https://pspdfkit.com/instant-json/v1"
Array of (Annotation JSON v2 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object) or CommentMarkerAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
object

Attachments are defined as an associative array.

  • Keys are SHA-256 hashes of the attachment contents or the pdfObjectId of the attachment (in case it's part of the source PDF).
  • Values are the actual Attachment objects with Base-64 encoded binary contents of the attachment and its content type.
Array of ButtonFormField (object) or ListBoxFormField (object) or ComboBoxFormField (object) or CheckBoxFormField (object) or RadioButtonFormField (object) or TextFormField (object) or SignatureFormField (object)
Array of objects
Array of objects
Array of Comment JSON v2 (object) or Comment JSON v1 (object)
skippedPdfObjectIds
Array of integers[ items >= 0 ]

An array of PDF object IDs that should be skipped during the import process. Whenever an object ID is marked as skipped, it'll no longer be loaded from the original PDF. Instead, it could be defined inside the annotations array with the same pdfObjectId. If this is the case, the PDF viewer will display the new annotation, which signals an update to the original one. If an object ID is marked as skipped but the annotations array doesn't contain an annotation with the same pdfObjectId, it'll be interpreted as a deleted annotation. An annotation inside the annotations array without the pdfObjectId property is interpreted as a newly created annotation.

object

PDF document identifiers, base64 encoded. This is used to track version of PDF document this JSON has been exported from.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
createdAt
required
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

documentId
required
string

The ID of the document.

required
Array of objects

An array of errors encountered during the operation.

password_protected
required
boolean

Indicates whether the document is password protected.

sourcePdfSha256
required
string

SHA256 hash of the PDF file underlying the document.

title
required
string or null

The document title.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/copy_with_instant_json

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
No sample

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
  • "documentId": "7KPZW8XFGM4F1C92KWBK1B748M",
  • "errors": [
    • {
      • "reason": "string"
      }
    ],
  • "password_protected": true,
  • "sourcePdfSha256": "1defd934dbbf77587eb9b7f45d162d2a3aea16c840a9e7cfa190fb2ea1f40a76",
  • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification"
}

Fetch Document Text

This endpoint allows you to fetch the text of all pages in a document.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array
pageIndex
required
integer >= 0

0-based index of the page.

required
Array of objects
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/text

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/text \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
[
  • {
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "textLines": [
      • {
        • "contents": "PSPDKit is a leading PDF SDK for Mobile and Web",
        • "height": 14,
        • "width": 331.7496337890625,
        • "left": 79.02290344238281,
        • "top": 312.2259521484375
        }
      ]
    }
]

Get Text of a Page in a Layer

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

pageIndex
required
integer >= 0

The index of the page in the document

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array of objects

All lines of text on the page.

Array
contents
required
string

Contents of the line of text.

height
number

Height of the line of text in points.

width
number

Width of the line of text in points.

left
number

Distance from the left edge of the page in points.

top
number

Distance from the top edge of the page in points.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/text

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/text \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "textLines": [
    • {
      • "contents": "PSPDKit is a leading PDF SDK for Mobile and Web",
      • "height": 14,
      • "width": 331.7496337890625,
      • "left": 79.02290344238281,
      • "top": 312.2259521484375
      }
    ]
}

Get Highlighted Text on a Page in a Layer

Highlighted text in the document refers to any text that is highlighted with any of the markup annotations like underline, strikeout, or highlight.

Note that the data returned by this endpoint is just an approximation and might not always exactly reflect the text highlighted in the PDF file.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

pageIndex
required
integer >= 0

The index of the page in the document

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array of objects

All highlighted text on the page.

Array
required
object

Represents a PDF annotation.

text
required
string

The highlighted text.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/highlighted

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/highlighted \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "annotation": {
        • "content": {
          • "v": 2,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "bbox": [
            • 255.10077620466092,
            • 656.7566095695641,
            • 145.91672653256705,
            • 18.390804597701162
            ],
          • "action": {
            • "type": "goTo",
            • "pageIndex": 0
            },
          • "opacity": 1,
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "flags": [
            • "noPrint"
            ],
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "name": "string",
          • "creatorName": "string",
          • "customData": {
            • "foo": "bar"
            },
          • "rects": [
            • [
              • 100,
              • 200,
              • 300,
              • 400
              ]
            ],
          • "blendMode": "normal",
          • "color": "#fcee7c",
          • "note": "This is a note.",
          • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
          },
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "group": "string"
        },
      • "text": "a very important piece of content"
      }
    ]
}

Renders a Page in a Layer

Returns an image with the rendered page from a document. Requires exactly one of width and height query parameters to set the required dimensions of the rendered image.

Annotation AP streams are not rendered by default, use render_ap_streams query parameter to enable AP streams rendering.

Rendered image format depends on the value of the Accept header. Supported content types are image/png (default) and image/webp.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

pageIndex
required
integer >= 0

The index of the page in the document

query Parameters
width
number

The width of the page to render.

height
number

The height of the page to render.

render_ap_streams
boolean

Whether to render annotation AP streams.

ocg_layers
Array of integers

A list of OCG Layer IDs

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: image/png
string <binary>
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/image

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url 'http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/image?width={number_value}&height={number_value}&render_ap_streams={boolean_value}&ocg_layers={array_value}' \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Edit the Layer and Persist the Result

This endpoints allows to use instructions pipeline for document modification.

The current document's layer can be referred to by using #self anchor.

{
  "document": { "id": "#self" }
}

The result of the processing will replace the layer after successful completion.

Please refer to Build Instructions schema for all options.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required
Array of FilePart (object) or HTMLPart (object) or NewPagePart (object) or DocumentPart (object)

Parts of the document to be built.

Multiple types of parts are supported:

  • FilePart that represents a binary input file that can be either a part name in the multipart/form-data request or an URL of a remote file.
  • HTMLPart that represents an HTML input file along with it's assets.
  • NewPagePart that represents a document with empty pages.
  • DocumentPart that represents a document (with optional layer) managed by Nutrient Document Engine. Only applicable if used in a Document Engine context.
Array of ApplyInstantJsonAction (object) or ApplyXfdfAction (object) or FlattenAction (object) or OcrAction (object) or RotateAction (object) or (WatermarkAction (Text (object) or Image (object))) or (CreateRedactionsAction (Preset (object) or Regex (object) or Text (object))) or ApplyRedactionsAction (object)

Actions to be performed on the document after it is built.

PDFOutput (object) or PDFAOutput (object) or PDFUAOutput (object) or ImageOutput (object) or JSONContentOutput (object) or OfficeOutput (object) or HTMLOutput (object) or MarkdownOutput (object)

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
passwordProtected
required
boolean

Indicates whether the document is password protected.

sourcePdfSha256
required
string

SHA256 hash of the PDF file underlying the document.

title
required
string or null

The document title.

byteSize
required
integer >= 1

The size of the document in bytes.

createdAt
required
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

object

Information about the assert storage for the underlying PDF file.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/apply_instructions

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
{
  • "parts": [
    • {
      • "file": "pdf-file-from-multipart"
      }
    ],
  • "actions": [
    • {
      • "type": "applyInstantJson",
      • "file": {
        • "url": "https://remote-file-storage/input-file",
        • "sha256": "string"
        }
      }
    ],
  • "output": {
    • "metadata": {
      • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification",
      • "author": "Document Author"
      },
    • "labels": [
      • {
        • "pages": [
          • [
            • 0
            ]
          ],
        • "label": "Page I-III"
        }
      ],
    • "user_password": "string",
    • "owner_password": "string",
    • "user_permissions": [
      • "printing"
      ],
    • "optimize": {
      • "grayscaleText": false,
      • "grayscaleGraphics": false,
      • "grayscaleImages": false,
      • "grayscaleFormFields": false,
      • "grayscaleAnnotations": false,
      • "disableImages": false,
      • "mrcCompression": false,
      • "imageOptimizationQuality": 2,
      • "linearize": false
      },
    • "type": "pdf"
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "passwordProtected": true,
    • "sourcePdfSha256": "1defd934dbbf77587eb9b7f45d162d2a3aea16c840a9e7cfa190fb2ea1f40a76",
    • "title": "Nutrient Document Engine API Specification",
    • "byteSize": 192000,
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "storage": {
      • "type": "built-in",
      • "bucket": "string",
      • "url": "string"
      }
    }
}

Get available OCG layers for layer

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
Array of OCGLayerObject (object) or OCGCollectionObject (object)

Array may contain either Layer or Collection

Array
Any of
ocgId
required
integer
name
required
string

Name of the layer that can be displayed in the UI.

radioGroup
integer
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/ocg-layers

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/ocg-layers \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "ocgs": [
    • {
      • "name": "Option 1",
      • "ocgId": 118,
      • "radioGroup": 0
      },
    • {
      • "name": "Option 2",
      • "ocgId": 108,
      • "radioGroup": 0
      },
    • {
      • "layers": [
        • {
          • "name": "Nested Layer 1",
          • "ocgId": 86
          },
        • {
          • "name": "Nested Layer 2",
          • "ocgId": 72
          }
        ],
      • "name": "Nested Layers",
      • "ocgId": 121
      },
    • {
      • "layers": [
        • {
          • "name": "Layer 1",
          • "ocgId": 86
          },
        • {
          • "name": "Layer 2",
          • "ocgId": 72
          }
        ],
      • "name": "Grouped layers"
      }
    ]
}

Annotations

Create, read, update, and delete annotations.

Get Annotations

You can use this endpoint to fetch all annotations from the document's default layer.

If Accept: application/json header is used, only the first 1000 annotations from the page will be returned. If the page has more than 1000 annotations, the truncated property in the response is set to true.

In order to consume greater number of annotations in a controlled manner, use application/x-ndjson as accepted content type. When Accept: application/x-ndjson header is used, the response will be returned as Newline delimited JSON, allowing the client to process annotations individually or in batches before the complete response body has been received.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema:
object
Array of objects
truncated
boolean

Indicates whether the returned annotations are not all of the document's annotations.

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
{
  • "data": {
    • "annotations": [
      • {
        • "content": {
          • "v": 2,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "bbox": [
            • 255.10077620466092,
            • 656.7566095695641,
            • 145.91672653256705,
            • 18.390804597701162
            ],
          • "action": {
            • "type": "goTo",
            • "pageIndex": 0
            },
          • "opacity": 1,
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "flags": [
            • "noPrint"
            ],
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "name": "string",
          • "creatorName": "string",
          • "customData": {
            • "foo": "bar"
            },
          • "rects": [
            • [
              • 100,
              • 200,
              • 300,
              • 400
              ]
            ],
          • "blendMode": "normal",
          • "color": "#fcee7c",
          • "note": "This is a note.",
          • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
          },
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "group": "string"
        }
      ],
    • "truncated": true
    }
}

Create Annotations

This endpoint allows you to add one or more new annotations to a document's default layer.

The endpoint accepts two content types:

  • application/json - in this case, the request body is a JSON representation of one or more annotation; you can check the schema for more details.
  • multipart/form-data - with multipart request, annotation(s) can be uploaded along with a new attachment. Annotations are one part of the request, followed by attachments.

The annotation id is optional, and will be generated by Document Engine if not provided. The user_id is set as the creator of the annotation.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required

One or more annotations to create.

One of
required
Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object)
user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

id
string

Annotation ID, unique in scope of a single Instant Layer.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
One of
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of successfully created / updated annotations.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
Example
{
  • "content": {
    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,
      • 145.91672653256705,
      • 18.390804597701162
      ],
    • "action": {
      • "type": "goTo",
      • "pageIndex": 0
      },
    • "opacity": 1,
    • "pdfObjectId": 0,
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "flags": [
      • "noPrint"
      ],
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "name": "string",
    • "creatorName": "string",
    • "customData": {
      • "foo": "bar"
      },
    • "rects": [
      • [
        • 100,
        • 200,
        • 300,
        • 400
        ]
      ],
    • "blendMode": "normal",
    • "color": "#fcee7c",
    • "note": "This is a note.",
    • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
    },
  • "user_id": "string",
  • "group": "string",
  • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
Example
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "name": "string",
        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "rects": [
          • [
            • 100,
            • 200,
            • 300,
            • 400
            ]
          ],
        • "blendMode": "normal",
        • "color": "#fcee7c",
        • "note": "This is a note.",
        • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
        },
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "updatedBy": "string"
      }
    ],
  • "failing_paths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.annotations[0]",
      • "error": "Page index out of bounds.",
      • "details": "The page index of the given annotation was greater than the number of pages in the document."
      }
    ]
}

Update Annotations

This endpoint allows you to update multiple annotations in the document's default layer.

The annotation's content will be completely replaced with the content provided in the request, and its updatedBy field will be set to user_id.

The endpoint accepts two content types:

  • application/json - in this case, the request body is a JSON representation of one or more annotation; you can check the schema for more details.
  • multipart/form-data - with multipart request, annotation(s) can be uploaded along with a new attachment. Annotations are one part of the request, followed by attachments.

The annotation id is required, and it should correspond to an already existing annotation in the document. The user_id is set as the creator of the annotation.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required

Multiple annotations to update.

required
Array of objects
Array
required
Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object)
id
required
string
user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of successfully created / updated annotations.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python

{
  • "annotations": [
    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,

          • 255.10077620466092,

        • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
        },
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "id": "replace_this_with_an_actual_annotation_id"
      }
    ]
}

Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",

  • "status": 200,
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,

    • {
      • "path": "$.annotations[0]",
      • "error": "Page index out of bounds.",
      • "details": "The page index of the given annotation was greater than the number of pages in the document."
      }
    ]
}

Delete Annotations

This endpoint allows you to remove multiple annotations from the document's default layer.

The endpoint accepts one content type application/json. The request body is either a JSON array of annotations ids, or "all" in order to remove all annotations in one go.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
All annotations (string) or Array of Annotation IDs (strings)
One of
string

The string "all" to remove all annotations.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "annotationIds": "all"
}

Fetch Annotations on a Page

You can use this endpoint to fetch annotations on the given page from the document's default layer.

If Accept: application/json header is used, only the first 1000 annotations from the page will be returned. If the page has more than 1000 annotations, the truncated property in the response is set to true.

In order to consume greater number of annotations in a controlled manner, use application/x-ndjson as accepted content type. When Accept: application/x-ndjson header is used, the response will be returned as Newline delimited JSON, allowing the client to process annotations individually or in batches before the complete response body has been received.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

pageIndex
required
integer >= 0

The index of the page in the document

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema:
object
Array of objects
truncated
boolean

Indicates whether the returned annotations are not all of the document's annotations.

/api/documents/{documentId}/pages/{pageIndex}/annotations

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/pages/{pageIndex}/annotations \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
{
  • "data": {
    • "annotations": [
      • {
        • "content": {
          • "v": 2,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "bbox": [
            • 255.10077620466092,
            • 656.7566095695641,
            • 145.91672653256705,
            • 18.390804597701162
            ],
          • "action": {
            • "type": "goTo",
            • "pageIndex": 0
            },
          • "opacity": 1,
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "flags": [
            • "noPrint"
            ],
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "name": "string",
          • "creatorName": "string",
          • "customData": {
            • "foo": "bar"
            },
          • "rects": [
            • [
              • 100,
              • 200,
              • 300,
              • 400
              ]
            ],
          • "blendMode": "normal",
          • "color": "#fcee7c",
          • "note": "This is a note.",
          • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
          },
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "group": "string"
        }
      ],
    • "truncated": true
    }
}

Get Annotation

Use this endpoint to get the annotation from the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

(Annotation Contents (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
id
string

Annotation ID, unique in scope of a single Instant Layer.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

  • 200
Content type

  • "content": {
    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,

      • "foo": "bar"

  • "createdBy": "string",
  • "updatedBy": "string",
  • "group": "string"
}

Update an Annotation

This endpoint allows you to update an annotation in the document's default layer.

The annotation's content will be completely replaced with the content provided in the request, and its updatedBy field will be set to user_id.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object)
user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

id
string

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId}

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "content": {
    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,
      • 145.91672653256705,
      • 18.390804597701162
      ],
    • "action": {
      • "type": "goTo",
      • "pageIndex": 0
      },
    • "opacity": 1,
    • "pdfObjectId": 0,
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "flags": [
      • "noPrint"
      ],
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "name": "string",
    • "creatorName": "string",
    • "customData": {
      • "foo": "bar"
      },
    • "rects": [
      • [
        • 100,
        • 200,
        • 300,
        • 400
        ]
      ],
    • "blendMode": "normal",
    • "color": "#fcee7c",
    • "note": "This is a note.",
    • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
    },
  • "user_id": "string",
  • "group": "string",
  • "id": "replace_this_with_an_actual_annotation_id"
}

Delete an Annotation

This endpoint allows you to delete an annotation in the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request DELETE \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Get Annotations in a Layer

You can use this endpoint to fetch all annotations from the given layer.

If Accept: application/json header is used, only the first 1000 annotations from the page will be returned. If the page has more than 1000 annotations, the truncated property in the response is set to true.

In order to consume greater number of annotations in a controlled manner, use application/x-ndjson as accepted content type. When Accept: application/x-ndjson header is used, the response will be returned as Newline delimited JSON, allowing the client to process annotations individually or in batches before the complete response body has been received.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema:
object
Array of objects
truncated
boolean

Indicates whether the returned annotations are not all of the document's annotations.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
{
  • "data": {
    • "annotations": [
      • {
        • "content": {
          • "v": 2,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "bbox": [
            • 255.10077620466092,
            • 656.7566095695641,
            • 145.91672653256705,
            • 18.390804597701162
            ],
          • "action": {
            • "type": "goTo",
            • "pageIndex": 0
            },
          • "opacity": 1,
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "flags": [
            • "noPrint"
            ],
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "name": "string",
          • "creatorName": "string",
          • "customData": {
            • "foo": "bar"
            },
          • "rects": [
            • [
              • 100,
              • 200,
              • 300,
              • 400
              ]
            ],
          • "blendMode": "normal",
          • "color": "#fcee7c",
          • "note": "This is a note.",
          • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
          },
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "group": "string"
        }
      ],
    • "truncated": true
    }
}

Create Annotations in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to add one or more new annotations to a specific layer in the document.

The endpoint accepts two content types:

  • application/json - in this case, the request body is a JSON representation of one or more annotation; you can check the schema for more details.
  • multipart/form-data - with multipart request, annotation(s) can be uploaded along with a new attachment. Annotations are one part of the request, followed by attachments.

The annotation id is optional, and will be generated by Document Engine if not provided. The user_id is set as the creator of the annotation.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required

One or more annotations to create.

One of
required
Array of objects
Array
required
Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object)
user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
One of
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of successfully created / updated annotations.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
Example
{
  • "annotations": [
    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "name": "string",
        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "rects": [
          • [
            • 100,
            • 200,
            • 300,
            • 400
            ]
          ],
        • "blendMode": "normal",
        • "color": "#fcee7c",
        • "note": "This is a note.",
        • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
        },
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string"
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
Example
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "name": "string",
        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "rects": [
          • [
            • 100,
            • 200,
            • 300,
            • 400
            ]
          ],
        • "blendMode": "normal",
        • "color": "#fcee7c",
        • "note": "This is a note.",
        • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
        },
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "updatedBy": "string"
      }
    ],
  • "failing_paths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.annotations[0]",
      • "error": "Page index out of bounds.",
      • "details": "The page index of the given annotation was greater than the number of pages in the document."
      }
    ]
}

Update Annotations in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to update multiple annotations in the document's specified layer.

The annotation's content will be completely replaced with the content provided in the request, and its updatedBy field will be set to user_id.

The endpoint accepts two content types:

  • application/json - in this case, the request body is a JSON representation of one or more annotation; you can check the schema for more details.
  • multipart/form-data - with multipart request, annotation(s) can be uploaded along with a new attachment. Annotations are one part of the request, followed by attachments.

The annotation id is required, and it should correspond to an already existing annotation in the document. The user_id is set as the creator of the annotation.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required

Multiple annotations to update.

required
Array of objects
Array
required
Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object)
id
required
string
user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of successfully created / updated annotations.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations

  • cURL
  • Node.js

  • C#
  • Python

{
  • "annotations": [
    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
        • "pageIndex": 0,

          • 255.10077620466092,

          },

          • "foo": "bar"

            • 100,

            • 300,
            • 400
            ]
          ],
        • "blendMode": "normal",
        • "color": "#fcee7c",
        • "note": "This is a note.",
        • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
        },
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "id": "replace_this_with_an_actual_annotation_id"
      }
    ]
}

  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",

  • "status": 200,

    • {
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
