      • "error": "Page index out of bounds.",
      • "details": "The page index of the given annotation was greater than the number of pages in the document."
      }
    ]
}

Delete Annotations in a Layer.

This endpoint allows you to remove multiple annotations from the given layer.

The endpoint accepts one content type application/json. The request body is either a JSON array of annotations ids, or "all" in order to remove all annotations in one go.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
All annotations (string) or Array of Annotation IDs (strings)
One of
string

The string "all" to remove all annotations.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "annotationIds": "all"
}

Get Annotations on a Page in a Layer

You can use this endpoint to fetch annotations on the given page from the given layer.

If Accept: application/json header is used, only the first 1000 annotations from the page will be returned. If the page has more than 1000 annotations, the truncated property in the response is set to true.

In order to consume greater number of annotations in a controlled manner, use application/x-ndjson as accepted content type. When Accept: application/x-ndjson header is used, the response will be returned as Newline delimited JSON, allowing the client to process annotations individually or in batches before the complete response body has been received.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

pageIndex
required
integer >= 0

The index of the page in the document

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema:
object
Array of objects
truncated
boolean

Indicates whether the returned annotations are not all of the document's annotations.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/annotations

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/pages/{pageIndex}/annotations \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
{
  • "data": {
    • "annotations": [
      • {
        • "content": {
          • "v": 2,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "bbox": [
            • 255.10077620466092,
            • 656.7566095695641,
            • 145.91672653256705,
            • 18.390804597701162
            ],
          • "action": {
            • "type": "goTo",
            • "pageIndex": 0
            },
          • "opacity": 1,
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "flags": [
            • "noPrint"
            ],
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "name": "string",
          • "creatorName": "string",
          • "customData": {
            • "foo": "bar"
            },
          • "rects": [
            • [
              • 100,
              • 200,
              • 300,
              • 400
              ]
            ],
          • "blendMode": "normal",
          • "color": "#fcee7c",
          • "note": "This is a note.",
          • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
          },
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "group": "string"
        }
      ],
    • "truncated": true
    }
}

Get an Annotation From a Layer

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

(Annotation Contents (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object))) or (Annotation JSON v1 (MarkupAnnotation (object) or RedactionAnnotation (object) or TextAnnotation (object) or InkAnnotation (object) or LinkAnnotation (object) or NoteAnnotation (object) or EllipseAnnotation (object) or RectangleAnnotation (object) or LineAnnotation (object) or PolylineAnnotation (object) or PolygonAnnotation (object) or ImageAnnotation (object) or StampAnnotation (object) or WidgetAnnotation (object)))
id
string

Annotation ID, unique in scope of a single Instant Layer.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "content": {
    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,
      • 145.91672653256705,
      • 18.390804597701162
      ],
    • "action": {
      • "type": "goTo",
      • "pageIndex": 0
      },
    • "opacity": 1,
    • "pdfObjectId": 0,
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "flags": [
      • "noPrint"
      ],
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "name": "string",
    • "creatorName": "string",
    • "customData": {
      • "foo": "bar"
      },
    • "rects": [
      • [
        • 100,
        • 200,
        • 300,
        • 400
        ]
      ],
    • "blendMode": "normal",
    • "color": "#fcee7c",
    • "note": "This is a note.",
    • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
    },
  • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
  • "createdBy": "string",
  • "updatedBy": "string",
  • "group": "string"
}

Update an Annotation in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to update an annotation in the given layer.

The annotation's content will be completely replaced with the content provided in the request, and its updatedBy field will be set to user_id.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object) or Annotation Contents (object)
user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

id
string

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId}

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "content": {
    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,
      • 145.91672653256705,
      • 18.390804597701162
      ],
    • "action": {
      • "type": "goTo",
      • "pageIndex": 0
      },
    • "opacity": 1,
    • "pdfObjectId": 0,
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "flags": [
      • "noPrint"
      ],
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "name": "string",
    • "creatorName": "string",
    • "customData": {
      • "foo": "bar"
      },
    • "rects": [
      • [
        • 100,
        • 200,
        • 300,
        • 400
        ]
      ],
    • "blendMode": "normal",
    • "color": "#fcee7c",
    • "note": "This is a note.",
    • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
    },
  • "user_id": "string",
  • "group": "string",
  • "id": "replace_this_with_an_actual_annotation_id"
}

Delete an Annotation in a Layer.

This endpoint allows you to delete an annotation in the given layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request DELETE \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Form Filling

Fill in the form fields and retrieve their values.

Get Form Field Values

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
Array of objects
Array
type
required
string
Value: "pspdfkit/form-field-value"
name
required
string

Unique name of the form field. This property is used to link form field value to a FormField.

v
required
integer
Value: 1

The specification version that the record is compliant to.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

(Single value (string or null)) or Array of Multiple values (strings)
optionIndexes
Array of integers

Radio buttons and checkboxes can have multiple widgets with the same form value associated, but can be selected independently. `optionIndexes`` contains the value indexes that should be actually set.

If set, the value field doesn't get used, and the widget found at the corresponding indexes in the form field's annotationIds property are checked.

If set on fields other than RadioButtonFormField or CheckBoxFormField, setting the form value will fail.

isFitting
boolean
Default: false

Specifies if the given text should fit into the visible portion of the text form field.

group
string or null

The form field value group. Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

The group of the form field value is always the group of the associated form field.

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-values

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-values \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "formFieldValues": [
      • {
        • "name": "string",
        • "value": "string",
        • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field-value",
        • "v": 1,
        • "optionIndexes": [
          • 0
          ],
        • "isFitting": false,
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "group": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Update Form Field Values

To update existing form field values, send a POST request with a JSON body containing the list of form fields and their values.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
Array of objects
Array
name
required
string
value
required
string

Responses

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-values

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "formFieldValues": [
    • {
      • "name": "string",
      • "value": "string"
      }
    ]
}

string

The document ID

  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

(Single value (string or null)) or Array of Multiple values (strings)

Default: false

Forms

Create, read, update and delete form fields and widget anotations.

A widget annotation describes the physical appearance of a form field in a PDF document, i.e. properties that are used to display the form field on a specific page in the PDF. For this reason, you need to create and associate widgets with the form fields you process using Nutrient Document Engine’s API.

For example, along with specifying the details of your text form field, you need to specify a widget annotation for that text form field by setting the widget’s ID in the text field’s content.annotationIds property.

Get Form Fields

You can use this endpoint to fetch all form fields from the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array of objects
Array
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

createdAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

updatedAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
Array of objects

The widgets associated with this form field.

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "group": "string",
      • "createdBy": "string",
      • "updatedBy": "string",
      • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 1,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
        • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
        • "name": "Form-Field",
        • "label": "Form Field",
        • "annotationIds": [
          • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
          ],
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "flags": [
          • "required"
          ],
        • "buttonLabel": "string"
        },
      • "widgetAnnotations": [
        • {
          • "id": "string",
          • "group": "string",
          • "createdBy": "string",
          • "updatedBy": "string",
          • "content": {
            • "v": 2,
            • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
            • "pageIndex": 0,
            • "bbox": [
              • 255.10077620466092,
              • 656.7566095695641,
              • 145.91672653256705,
              • 18.390804597701162
              ],
            • "action": {
              • "type": "goTo",
              • "pageIndex": 0
              },
            • "opacity": 1,
            • "pdfObjectId": 0,
            • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
            • "flags": [
              • "noPrint"
              ],
            • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
            • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
            • "name": "string",
            • "creatorName": "string",
            • "customData": {
              • "foo": "bar"
              },
            • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
            • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
            • "borderStyle": "solid",
            • "borderWidth": 0,
            • "font": "Helvetica",
            • "fontSize": 10,
            • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
            • "fontStyle": [
              • "bold"
              ],
            • "horizontalAlign": "left",
            • "verticalAlign": "top",
            • "rotation": 0,
            • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
}

Create Form Fields

This endpoint allows you to add a new form field to the document's default layer.

The id of each form field is optional, and will be generated by Document Engine if not provided. The user_id is set as the creator of the form field. The group of the form field will be inherited by the widgets and values associated with it.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of the IDs for the newly created form fields

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "formFields": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 1,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
        • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
        • "name": "Form-Field",
        • "label": "Form Field",
        • "annotationIds": [
          • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
          ],
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "flags": [
          • "required"
          ],
        • "buttonLabel": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      }
    ]
}

Update Form Fields

This endpoint allows you to update an existing form field in the document's default layer

The id is required. If you provide the group in this operation then the new group will cascade to all the widgets and values associated with this field.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of IDs for the form fields that were updated successfully.

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "formFields": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 1,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
        • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
        • "name": "Form-Field",
        • "label": "Form Field",
        • "annotationIds": [
          • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
          ],
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "flags": [
          • "required"
          ],
        • "buttonLabel": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      }
    ]
}

Delete Form Fields

This endpoint allows you to remove multiple form fields from the document's default layer.

Deleting a form field will cascade delete all its associated widgets and values.

The endpoint accepts content type application/json. The request body is an object with a field formFieldIds that is set to either a JSON array of IDs, or "all" in order to remove all form fields in one request.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
One of
formFieldIds
required
Array of strings

An array of form field IDs

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of IDs for the form fields that were successfully deleted

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
Example
{
  • "formFieldIds": [
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEM"
    ],
  • "user_id": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ"
      },
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQKMM"
      }
    ]
}

Get a Form Field

Use this endpoint to get the form field with the specified ID from the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

formFieldId
required
string

The ID of the form field

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

createdAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

updatedAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
Array of objects

The widgets associated with this form field.

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields/{formFieldId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/form-fields/{formFieldId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
  • "group": "string",
  • "createdBy": "string",
  • "updatedBy": "string",
  • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
  • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
  • "content": {
    • "v": 1,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
    • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
    • "name": "Form-Field",
    • "label": "Form Field",
    • "annotationIds": [
      • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
      ],
    • "pdfObjectId": 0,
    • "flags": [
      • "required"
      ],
    • "buttonLabel": "string"
    },
  • "widgetAnnotations": [
    • {
      • "id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "createdBy": "string",
      • "updatedBy": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "name": "string",
        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
        • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
        • "borderStyle": "solid",
        • "borderWidth": 0,
        • "font": "Helvetica",
        • "fontSize": 10,
        • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
        • "fontStyle": [
          • "bold"
          ],
        • "horizontalAlign": "left",
        • "verticalAlign": "top",
        • "rotation": 0,
        • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Get Widgets

You can use this endpoint to fetch all widgets from the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array of objects
Array
id
required
string

An identifier for a form field widget. It is unique across a layer

group
required
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

object
/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "string",

          • "noPrint"

        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",

        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },

          • "flags": [
            • "required"
            ],
          • "buttonLabel": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    ]
}

Create Widgets

This endpoint allows you to add a new widget to the document's default layer.

The id is optional, and will be generated by Document Engine if not provided.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

id
string

An identifier for a widget. It is unique across a layer

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects
/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "formFieldWidgets": [
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZE",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "name": "string",
        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
        • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
        • "borderStyle": "solid",
        • "borderWidth": 0,
        • "font": "Helvetica",
        • "fontSize": 10,
        • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
        • "fontStyle": [
          • "bold"
          ],
        • "horizontalAlign": "left",
        • "verticalAlign": "top",
        • "rotation": 0,
        • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
        }
      }
    ]
}

  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",

    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",

      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ"
      },
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQKMM"
      }
    ]
}

Update Widgets

This endpoint allows you to update an existing widget in the document's default layer

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

id
required
string

This is an identifier for this widget. It is unique across the layer. It is required for update operations.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects
/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets

          • "foo": "bar"

      }
    ]
}

Delete Widgets

This endpoint allows you to remove multiple widgets from the document's default layer.

The endpoint accepts content type application/json. The request body is an object that is set to either a JSON array of widget ids, or "all" in order to remove all widgets in one go.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
One of
formFieldWidgetIds
required
Array of strings

An array of widget IDs

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of IDs for the widgets that were successfully deleted

/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
Example
{
  • "formFieldWidgetIds": [
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEM"
    ],
  • "user_id": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,

    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZE"
      }
    ]
}

Get a Widget

Use this endpoint to get the widget with the specified ID from the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

formFieldWidgetId
required
string

The ID of the form field widget

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
id
required
string

An identifier for a form field widget. It is unique across a layer

group
required
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

object
/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets/{formFieldWidgetId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python

  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/form-field-widgets/{formFieldWidgetId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "id": "string",

    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,

      • "noPrint"
      ],
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "name": "string",
    • "creatorName": "string",
    • "customData": {
      • "foo": "bar"
      },
    • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
    • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
    • "borderStyle": "solid",
    • "borderWidth": 0,
    • "font": "Helvetica",
    • "fontSize": 10,
    • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
    • "fontStyle": [
      • "bold"
      ],
    • "horizontalAlign": "left",
    • "verticalAlign": "top",
    • "rotation": 0,
    • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
    },
  • "formField": {
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "group": "string",
    • "createdBy": "string",
    • "updatedBy": "string",
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "content": {
      • "v": 1,
      • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
      • "name": "Form-Field",
      • "label": "Form Field",
      • "annotationIds": [
        • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
        ],
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "flags": [
        • "required"
        ],
      • "buttonLabel": "string"
      }
    }
}

Get Form Fields in a Layer

You can use this endpoint to fetch all form fields from a document's layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array of objects
Array
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

createdAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

updatedAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
Array of objects

The widgets associated with this form field.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "group": "string",
      • "createdBy": "string",
      • "updatedBy": "string",
      • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 1,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
        • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
        • "name": "Form-Field",
        • "label": "Form Field",
        • "annotationIds": [
          • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
          ],
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "flags": [
          • "required"
          ],
        • "buttonLabel": "string"
        },
      • "widgetAnnotations": [
        • {
          • "id": "string",
          • "group": "string",
          • "createdBy": "string",
          • "updatedBy": "string",
          • "content": {
            • "v": 2,
            • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
            • "pageIndex": 0,
            • "bbox": [
              • 255.10077620466092,
              • 656.7566095695641,
              • 145.91672653256705,
              • 18.390804597701162
              ],
            • "action": {
              • "type": "goTo",
              • "pageIndex": 0
              },
            • "opacity": 1,
            • "pdfObjectId": 0,
            • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
            • "flags": [
              • "noPrint"
              ],
            • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
            • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
            • "name": "string",
            • "creatorName": "string",
            • "customData": {
              • "foo": "bar"
              },
            • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
            • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
            • "borderStyle": "solid",
            • "borderWidth": 0,
            • "font": "Helvetica",
            • "fontSize": 10,
            • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
            • "fontStyle": [
              • "bold"
              ],
            • "horizontalAlign": "left",
            • "verticalAlign": "top",
            • "rotation": 0,
            • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
}

Create Form Fields in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to add a new form field to a layer of the document.

The id is optional, and will be generated by Document Engine if not provided. The group of the form field will be inherited by the widgets and form field values associated with it. The user_id is set as the creator of the form field.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of the form field IDs for the form fields that were successfully created.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "formFields": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 1,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
        • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
        • "name": "Form-Field",
        • "label": "Form Field",
        • "annotationIds": [
          • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
          ],
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "flags": [
          • "required"
          ],
        • "buttonLabel": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      }
    ]
}

Update Form Fields in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to update an existing form field in a document's layer.

The id is required. If you provide the group in this operation then the new group will cascade to all the widgets and form field values associated with this field in this layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python

application/json

  • "formFields": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",

        • "label": "Form Field",
        • "annotationIds": [
          • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
          • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
          ],
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "flags": [
          • "required"
          ],
        • "buttonLabel": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
}

  • 200

  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,

    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      }
    ]
}

Delete Form Fields in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to remove multiple form fields from a document's layer.

Deleting a form field will cascade delete all its associated widgets and values in the specified layer.

The endpoint accepts content type application/json. The request body is an object with a field formFieldIds that is set to either a JSON array of IDs, or "all" in order to remove all form fields in one request.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
One of
formFieldIds
required
Array of strings

An array of form field IDs

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of IDs for the form fields that were successfully deleted

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
Example
{
  • "formFieldIds": [
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEM"
    ],
  • "user_id": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      },
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEM"
      }
    ]
}

Get a Form Field in a Layer

Use this endpoint to get the form field with a specified ID from a layer of the document

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

formFieldId
required
string

The ID of the form field

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

createdAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

updatedAt
string

Date and time in ISO8601 format with timezone.

Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object) or Form field JSON (object)
Array of objects

The widgets associated with this form field.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields/{formFieldId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-fields/{formFieldId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json

  • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",

      • "required"

Get Widgets in a Layer

You can use this endpoint to fetch all widgets from a layer of the documents. The response will also contain details of the formField each widget is associated with, if it is associated with a form field.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
Array of objects
Array
id
required
string

An identifier for a form field widget. It is unique across a layer

group
required
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

object
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-field-widgets

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-field-widgets \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "createdBy": "string",
      • "updatedBy": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,

        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],

        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",

        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
        • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
        • "borderStyle": "solid",
        • "borderWidth": 0,
        • "font": "Helvetica",
        • "fontSize": 10,
        • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
        • "fontStyle": [
          • "bold"
          ],
        • "horizontalAlign": "left",
        • "verticalAlign": "top",
        • "rotation": 0,
