        },
      • "formField": {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "group": "string",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "content": {
          • "v": 1,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
          • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
          • "name": "Form-Field",
          • "label": "Form Field",
          • "annotationIds": [
            • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
            • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
            ],
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "flags": [
            • "required"
            ],
          • "buttonLabel": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    ]
}

Create Widgets in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to add a new widget to a layer of the document

The id is optional, and will be generated by Document Engine if not provided.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

id
string

An identifier for a widget. It is unique across a layer

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

IDs of the widgets that were successfully created

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-field-widgets

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "formFieldWidgets": [
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZE",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "v": 2,
        • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
        • "pageIndex": 0,
        • "bbox": [
          • 255.10077620466092,
          • 656.7566095695641,
          • 145.91672653256705,
          • 18.390804597701162
          ],
        • "action": {
          • "type": "goTo",
          • "pageIndex": 0
          },
        • "opacity": 1,
        • "pdfObjectId": 0,
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "flags": [
          • "noPrint"
          ],
        • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
        • "name": "string",
        • "creatorName": "string",
        • "customData": {
          • "foo": "bar"
          },
        • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
        • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
        • "borderStyle": "solid",
        • "borderWidth": 0,
        • "font": "Helvetica",
        • "fontSize": 10,
        • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
        • "fontStyle": [
          • "bold"
          ],
        • "horizontalAlign": "left",
        • "verticalAlign": "top",
        • "rotation": 0,
        • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ"
      },
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQKMM"
      }
    ]
}

Update Widgets in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to update an existing widget in a layer of the document

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
required
Array of objects
Array
required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

id
required
string

This is an identifier for this widget. It is unique across the layer. It is required for update operations.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

IDs of the widgets that were successfully updated

          • "noPrint"
          ],

        • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",

        • "creatorName": "string",

          • "foo": "bar"

      }
    ]

Delete Widgets in a Layer

This endpoint allows you to remove multiple widgets from a layer of the document.

The endpoint accepts content type application/json. The request body is an object with a field formFieldWidgetIds that is set to either a JSON array of IDs, or "all" in order to remove all widgets in one request.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
One of
formFieldWidgetIds
required
Array of strings

An array of widget IDs

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
details
string

A text summary of the status of the request

request_id
string
result
string
Enum: "partial_failure" "success" "failure"

If all the items in the batch request were successful, then the status will be a success. A partial_failure will occur if only a few of the items in the batch request succeeded. Failure is when none of the items in the batch succeed.

status
integer
Enum: 200 400 500

HTTP status code for the request. The status code is 200 if the request was processed. This does not have anything to do with the result - the status code will be 200 even if part of the request failed. In the case of total failures such as malformed JSON, or document not found, this status will be other than 200.

Array of objects

List of failing paths.

Array of objects

An array of IDs for the widgets that were successfully deleted

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-field-widgets

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
Example
{
  • "formFieldWidgetIds": [
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEM"
    ],
  • "user_id": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "details": "Operation was partially successful",
  • "request_id": "string",
  • "result": "partial_failure",
  • "status": 200,
  • "failingPaths": [
    • {
      • "path": "$.property[0]",
      • "details": "Missing required property"
      }
    ],
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ"
      },
    • {
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQKMM"
      }
    ]
}

Get a Widget in a Layer

Use this endpoint to get the widget with the specified ID from a layer of the document

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

formFieldWidgetId
required
string

The ID of the form field widget

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
id
required
string

An identifier for a form field widget. It is unique across a layer

group
required
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

required
object

JSON representation of the form field widget annotation. Widget annotations are a type of annotation with the type always being 'pspdfkit/widget'.

object
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-field-widgets/{formFieldWidgetId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/form-field-widgets/{formFieldWidgetId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "id": "string",

  • "createdBy": "string",
  • "updatedBy": "string",
  • "content": {
    • "v": 2,
    • "type": "pspdfkit/widget",
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "bbox": [
      • 255.10077620466092,
      • 656.7566095695641,
      • 145.91672653256705,
      • 18.390804597701162
      ],
    • "action": {
      • "type": "goTo",
      • "pageIndex": 0
      },
    • "opacity": 1,
    • "pdfObjectId": 0,
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "flags": [
      • "noPrint"
      ],
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "name": "string",
    • "creatorName": "string",
    • "customData": {
      • "foo": "bar"
      },
    • "formFieldName": "First-Name",
    • "borderColor": "#ffffff",
    • "borderStyle": "solid",
    • "borderWidth": 0,
    • "font": "Helvetica",
    • "fontSize": 10,
    • "fontColor": "#ffffff",
    • "fontStyle": [
      • "bold"
      ],
    • "horizontalAlign": "left",
    • "verticalAlign": "top",
    • "rotation": 0,
    • "backgroundColor": "#000000"
    },
  • "formField": {
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
    • "group": "string",
    • "createdBy": "string",
    • "updatedBy": "string",
    • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
    • "content": {
      • "v": 1,
      • "type": "pspdfkit/form-field/button",
      • "id": "7KPSXX1NMNJ2WFDKN7BKQK9KZ",
      • "name": "Form-Field",
      • "label": "Form Field",
      • "annotationIds": [
        • "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "7KPS6T4DKYN71VB7G5KBGB5R51"
        ],
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "flags": [
        • "required"
        ],
      • "buttonLabel": "string"
      }
    }
}

Comments

Each comment is attached to a root annotation. Comments under the same root annotation form a single comment thread. The root annotation serves as an anchor for comments, marking their position in a document. Currently, only comment marker annotations and markup annotations can be used as root annotations.

Working with Root Annotations

Root annotations are regular annotations stored on Nutrient Document Engine. They can be fetched, created, updated, and deleted using our server-to-server annotation APIs. However, there are a couple rules that apply only to root annotations:

  • When they’re deleted, all comments attached to them are deleted as well.
  • When the last comment under the root annotation is deleted, the annotation itself is removed.

Comment Markers

pspdfkit/comment-marker is an annotation type used for marking a comment thread’s position in the document. It can be manipulated using the annotation APIs, just like any other annotation can. However, it’s only available if the Instant Comments component is enabled in the license.

Get Comments For a Root Annotation

Use this endpoint to list all the annotation attached to the given annotation in the document's default layer.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
required
Array of objects

A list of all comments under the given annotation

Array
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

group
required
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

required
Comments JSON (object) or Comments JSON (object)
/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId}/comments

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId}/comments \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "comments": [
      • {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "group": "string",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "content": {
          • "type": "pspdfkit/comment",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "rootId": "01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG",
          • "text": {
            • "format": "xhtml",
            • "value": "Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."
            },
          • "v": 2,
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "creatorName": "John Doe",
          • "customData": { },
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
}

Add Comments to a Root Annotation

Use this endpoint to add new comments to an existing annotation in the document's default layer. Note that the annotation needs to be either a markup annotation or a comment marker. The id and createdAt properties of the comment are autogenerated by Document Engine if they are not provided.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
Array of objects

A list of comments to be added

Array
required
object
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
required
Array of objects

IDs of the added comments

Array
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

/api/documents/{documentId}/annotations/{annotationId}/comments

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "comments": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "text": "What a wonderful idea!",
        • "createdAt": "2019-11-14T15:05:03.089Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-11-22T18:05:03.712Z",
        • "customData": { },
        • "creatorName": "John Doe"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 422
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "comments": [
      • {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Adds Comments

Use this endpoint to add comments and their root annotation at the same time.

Note that the annotation needs to be either a markup annotation or a comment marker.

The id and createdAt properties of the comment are autogenerated by Document Engine if they are not provided.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
object

Represents a single annotation to be created.

required
Array of objects

A list of comments to be added

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
required
object
required
Array of objects

IDs of the added comments

/api/documents/{documentId}/comments

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "annotation": {
    • "content": {
      • "v": 2,
      • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
      • "pageIndex": 0,
      • "bbox": [
        • 255.10077620466092,
        • 656.7566095695641,
        • 145.91672653256705,
        • 18.390804597701162
        ],
      • "action": {
        • "type": "goTo",
        • "pageIndex": 0
        },
      • "opacity": 1,
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "flags": [
        • "noPrint"
        ],
      • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "name": "string",
      • "creatorName": "string",
      • "customData": {
        • "foo": "bar"
        },
      • "rects": [
        • [
          • 100,
          • 200,
          • 300,
          • 400
          ]
        ],
      • "blendMode": "normal",
      • "color": "#fcee7c",
      • "note": "This is a note.",
      • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
      },
    • "user_id": "string",
    • "group": "string",
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
    },
  • "comments": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "text": "What a wonderful idea!",
        • "createdAt": "2019-11-14T15:05:03.089Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-11-22T18:05:03.712Z",
        • "customData": { },
        • "creatorName": "John Doe"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 422
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "annotation": {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      },
    • "comments": [
      • {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Get Comments For a Root Annotation in a Layer

Use this endpoint to list all the comments attached to the given annotation in the document's layer with the specified name.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
required
Array of objects

A list of all comments under the given annotation

Array
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

group
required
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

createdBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
required
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

required
Comments JSON (object) or Comments JSON (object)
/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId}/comments

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId}/comments \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "comments": [
      • {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
        • "group": "string",
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "content": {
          • "type": "pspdfkit/comment",
          • "pageIndex": 0,
          • "rootId": "01HBDGR9D5JTFERPSCEMNH5GPG",
          • "text": {
            • "format": "xhtml",
            • "value": "Annotation with <b>xhtml</b> contents."
            },
          • "v": 2,
          • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
          • "creatorName": "John Doe",
          • "customData": { },
          • "pdfObjectId": 0,
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
}

Add Comments to a Root Annotation in a Layer

Use this endpoint to add new comments to the existing annotation in the given layer. Note that the annotation needs to be either a markup annotation or a comment marker. The id and createdAt properties of the comment are autogenerated by Document Engine if they are not provided.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

annotationId
required
string

The ID of the annotation

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
Array of objects

A list of comments to be added

Array
required
object
id
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

user_id
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

group
string or null

The resource group.

Group allows to grant access to resources via Collaboration Permissions.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
required
Array of objects

IDs of the added comments

Array
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/annotations/{annotationId}/comments

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "comments": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "text": "What a wonderful idea!",
        • "createdAt": "2019-11-14T15:05:03.089Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-11-22T18:05:03.712Z",
        • "customData": { },
        • "creatorName": "John Doe"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 422
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "comments": [
      • {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Add Comments in a Layer

Use this endpoint to add comments and their root annotation at the same time.

Note that the annotation needs to be either a markup annotation or a comment marker.

The id and createdAt properties of the comment are autogenerated by Document Engine if they are not provided.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
object

Represents a single annotation to be created.

required
Array of objects

A list of comments to be added

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
required
object
required
object
required
Array of objects

IDs of the added comments

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/comments

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "annotation": {
    • "content": {
      • "v": 2,
      • "type": "pspdfkit/markup/highlight",
      • "pageIndex": 0,
      • "bbox": [
        • 255.10077620466092,
        • 656.7566095695641,
        • 145.91672653256705,
        • 18.390804597701162
        ],
      • "action": {
        • "type": "goTo",
        • "pageIndex": 0
        },
      • "opacity": 1,
      • "pdfObjectId": 0,
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "flags": [
        • "noPrint"
        ],
      • "createdAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z",
      • "name": "string",
      • "creatorName": "string",
      • "customData": {
        • "foo": "bar"
        },
      • "rects": [
        • [
          • 100,
          • 200,
          • 300,
          • 400
          ]
        ],
      • "blendMode": "normal",
      • "color": "#fcee7c",
      • "note": "This is a note.",
      • "isCommentThreadRoot": true
      },
    • "user_id": "string",
    • "group": "string",
    • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
    },
  • "comments": [
    • {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ",
      • "user_id": "string",
      • "group": "string",
      • "content": {
        • "text": "What a wonderful idea!",
        • "createdAt": "2019-11-14T15:05:03.089Z",
        • "updatedAt": "2019-11-22T18:05:03.712Z",
        • "customData": { },
        • "creatorName": "John Doe"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 422
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "annotation": {
      • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
      },
    • "comments": [
      • {
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Bookmarks

Create, read, update, and delete bookmarks.

Fetch Bookmarks

Fetches all bookmarks in a given document.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
Array of objects
Array
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

required
object

A record representing a bookmark.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

/api/documents/{documentId}/bookmarks

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/bookmarks \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "bookmarks": [
      • {
        • "content": {
          • "name": "string",
          • "type": "pspdfkit/bookmark",
          • "v": 1,
          • "action": {
            • "type": "goTo",
            • "pageIndex": 0
            },
          • "pdfBookmarkId": "string"
          },
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Create a Bookmark

Bookmarks can be created with and without specifying the ID for the bookmark. When no ID is specified, Document Engine will assign a random ID to the bookmark. If you want to rely on a specific ID being the ID of the created bookmark, the ID can be set with the id property in the JSON payload. This is useful if you, for example, want a bookmark with the same ID in multiple documents.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

required
object

A record representing a bookmark.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
id
required
string
/api/documents/{documentId}/bookmarks

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
application/json
{
  • "content": {
    • "name": "string",
    • "type": "pspdfkit/bookmark",
    • "v": 1,
    • "action": {
      • "type": "goTo",
      • "pageIndex": 0
      },
    • "pdfBookmarkId": "string"
    },
  • "createdBy": "string",
  • "updatedBy": "string",
  • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "string"
    }
}

  • "id": "01DNEDPQQ22W49KDXRFPG4EPEQ"
}

string

The document ID

bookmarkId
required
string

The ID of the bookmark

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

  • C#
  • Python

  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/bookmarks/{bookmarkId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Create a Bookmark in a Layer

Bookmarks can be created with and without specifying the ID for the bookmark. When no ID is specified, Document Engine will assign a random ID to the bookmark. If you want to rely on a specific ID being the ID of the created bookmark, the ID can be set with the id property in the JSON payload. This is useful if you, for example, want a bookmark with the same ID in multiple documents.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
id
required
string

An unique Instant JSON identifier of the record. Must be unique in a layer.

required
object

A record representing a bookmark.

createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Attachments

Retrieve document attachments.

Get Attachment

Attachments are files that are attached to a document.

This endpoint provides a way to fetch an attachment's contents.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

attachmentId
required
string

The ID of the attachment

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema:
string <binary>

The binary content of the image file.

/api/documents/{documentId}/attachments/{attachmentId}

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/attachments/{attachmentId} \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Embedded files

Retrieve embedded files.

Fetch Embedded Files

Returned records describe files that are attached to a document.

Use attachments API to retrieve the actual file contents.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
Array of objects
Array
id
required
string
object
createdBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

updatedBy
string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

/api/documents/{documentId}/embedded-files

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/embedded-files \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "embeddedFiles": [
      • {
        • "content": {
          • "v": 1,
          • "type": "pspdfkit/embedded-file",
          • "fileAttachmentId": "string",
          • "contentType": "string",
          • "description": "string",
          • "fileName": "string",
          • "fileSize": 22348,
          • "updatedAt": "2019-09-16T15:05:03.712909Z"
          },
        • "createdBy": "string",
        • "updatedBy": "string",
        • "id": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Get Layers's Embedded Files

Returned records describe files that are attached to a layer.

Use attachments API to retrieve the actual file contents.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

object
Array of objects

id
required
string

string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

string or null

The user identifier.

Note that Nutrient Document Engine does not provide any kind of user management and accepts any string (or null) as a valid user ID.

For records created or updated in the browser, the user_id is extracted from the JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication.

Digital Signatures

Nutrient Document Engine supports reading and applying digital signatures to PDF documents.

A digital signature is an electronic fingerprint uniquely identifying the signing person. A digital signature on a PDF document is both reliable proof of the document’s origin and protection against modification by third parties.

Digitally Sign a PDF File

Use this endpoint to digitally sign a PDF file.

Signing Service

The actual signing of the file is performed by a signing service callback that needs to be maintained and operated separately. It needs to expose a single HTTP endpoint that receives all callbacks required during the document signing flow differentiated by an action property in the request's JSON.

URL of the signing service needs to be configured via SIGNING_SERVICE_URL environment variable.

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: multipart/form-data
file
string <binary>

The binary content of a PDF file.

object
image
string <binary>

The watermark image to be used as part of the signature's appearance

graphicImage
string <binary>

The graphic image to be used as part of the signature's appearance

Responses

Response Schema: application/pdf
string <binary>

The signed PDF file.

Callbacks

/api/sign

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/sign \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password' \
  --form 'file=<PDF data>' \
  --form 'data={"signatureType":"cades","flatten":false,"appearance":{"mode":"signatureOnly","contentType":"image/png","showWatermark":true,"showSignDate":true,"showSigner":true,"showReason":true,"showLocation":true},"position":{"pageIndex":0,"rect":[0,0,100,100]},"cadesLevel":"b-lt","signatureContainer":"raw","signingToken":"user-1-with-rights","signatureMetadata":{"signerName":"John Appleseed","signatureReason":"accepted","signatureLocation":"Vienna"}}' \
  --form 'image=<Image data>' \
  --form 'graphicImage=<Image data>'

Callback payload samples

Callback
Content type
application/json
{
  • "action": "sign_pkcs7",
  • "signature_type": "cades",
  • "digest": "1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef",
  • "hash_algorithm": "sha256",
  • "encoded_contents": "YmFzZSA2NCBlbmNvZGVkIGNvbnRlbnRzIG9mIHRoZSBkb2N1bWVudAo",
  • "signing_token": "custom_signing_token"
}

Inspect Digital Signatures in a PDF file

Returns PDF file's digital signatures.

A document's digital signature status is computed by looking at all the digital signatures included in the document

The validity of a signature is determined by the signing certificate used to create it: If you're using a custom certificate, you need to set up Document Engine to use a corresponding certificate store in order to identify the signature as valid. Please check our guide article on how to set up custom certificates for digital signature validation.

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
required
string <binary>

The binary content of the PDF file.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
checkedAt
string <datetime>
documentModifiedSinceSignature
boolean
status
string
Enum: "valid" "warning" "error"
Array of objects
/api/inspect_signatures

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/inspect_signatures \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'content-type: multipart/form-data' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password' \
  --form 'file=<PDF data>'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "checkedAt": "string",
    • "documentModifiedSinceSignature": true,
    • "status": "valid",
    • "signatures": [
      • {
        • "signerName": "John Appleseed",
        • "creationDate": "2013-12-19 14:45:26",
        • "signatureReason": "accepted",
        • "signatureLocation": "Vienna",
        • "documentIntegrityStatus": "ok",
        • "certificateChainValidationStatus": "ok",
        • "signatureValidationStatus": "valid",
        • "isTrusted": true,
        • "isSelfSigned": true,
        • "isExpired": true,
        • "documentModifiedSinceSignature": true,
        • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
        • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
        • "type": "pspdfkit/signature-info",
        • "signatureFormFQN": "Signature-a9c0376e-15cd-416f-9b8f-bbf341fae0ca",
        • "ltv": false,
        • "signatureType": "cms",
        • "signingCertificateChain": [
          • {
            • "isCACertificate": false,
            • "isSelfSigned": false,
            • "issuerCommonName": "Example CA",
            • "serialNumberHex": "1234567890ABCDEF",
            • "subjectCommonName": "John Appleseed",
            • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
            • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
            • "type": "pspdfkit/certificate"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
}

Digitally Sign a Document

Use this endpoint to digitally sign a document.

Signing Service

The actual signing of the current state of the document is performed by a signing service callback that needs to be maintained and operated separately. It needs to expose a single HTTP endpoint that receives all callbacks required during the document signing flow differentiated by an action property in the request's JSON.

URL of the signing service needs to be configured via SIGNING_SERVICE_URL environment variable.

Watermark and Graphic

The appearance of a digital signature can include a watermark, which is an image typically depicting a company logo or stamp placed in the center, and a graphic, which is an image usually containing the signer's name in the form of a handwritten signature image positioned on the left side of the signature. You can find more information about these different signature appearance options at https://www.nutrient.io/guides/document-engine/signatures/signature-lifecycle/configure-digital-signature-appearance/.

To specify the image to be used as the watermark or graphic in the digital signature, send a multipart request with the application/json part containing the sign request options and the image part containing the watermark image, and the graphicImage part containing the graphic.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
signatureType
required
string
Default: "cms"
Enum: "cms" "cades"

The signature type to create. Note: While this field is required if sending signature parameters, the entire data object itself is optional in the multipart request.

flatten
boolean
Default: false

Controls whether to flatten the document before signing it. This is useful when you want the document's appearance to remain stable before signing and to ensure there's no indication that the document can be edited after signing.

Note that the resulting document's records (annotations and form fields) will be deleted.

formFieldName
string

Name of the signature form field to sign. Use this when signing an existing signature form field. If a signature field with this name does not exist in the document, it will be created at the position specified with position.

If a signature field with the specified name exists and position is also set, the request will result in an error.

Note: Either formFieldName or position must be provided if creating a visible signature.

object

The appearance settings for the visible signature. Omit if you want an invisible signature to be created.

object

Position of the visible signature form field. Omit if you want an invisible signature or if you specified the formFieldName option.

object

Optional metadata that describes the digital signature and becomes part of the signature itself. This information will be shown by PDF readers to end users and can be included in the visual appearance of the signature if you opted for a visible signature and enabled the necessary options in appearance.

cadesLevel
string
Default: "b-lt"
Enum: "b-lt" "b-t" "b-b"

The CAdES level to use when creating the signature. The default value is CAdES B-LT. This parameter is ignored when the signatureType is cms.

This is more like a hint of what level to use, and you should be aware that the API can return b-b even when you ask for b-lt. This can happen when the timestamp authority server is down, etc.

If this API is invoked with the Document Engine, you can override the default with the following environment variable: DIGITAL_SIGNATURE_CADES_LEVEL.

For Long-Term Validation (LTV) of the signature - when this API is invoked with the Document Engine - you need to ensure that the signing certificate chain links to a trusted anchor Certificate Authority (CA) at the time of signing.

To add the root CA and necessary intermediate CAs to your Document Engine instance, follow the instructions in our guide on Providing Trusted Root Certificates.

signatureContainer
string
Enum: "pkcs7" "raw"

Controls the signature container that will be requested from the signing service:

  • pkcs7 - signing service is expected to return PKCS#7 container with signed data.
  • raw - signing service is expected to return RSA signed data directly. Expects PKCS#1 v1.5 signed data.

The default value is pkcs7.

hashAlgorithm
string
Enum: "md5" "sha160" "sha224" "sha256" "sha384" "sha512"

The hash algorithm to use when computing the digest of the document.

The default value is sha256. It is recommended to use sha256 or better.

certificates
Array of strings

A set of base64-encoded X.509 certificates that will be used to sign the document.

Required for raw signature container or cades signature type. If not provided, will be requested from the signing service.

signingToken
string

A string token that will be forwarded to the underlying signing service.

estimatedSize
integer >= 0

Estimated size of the signature (in bytes). The estimated size is the size for the signature that will be reserved in the PDF document before digitally signing it.

A big estimated size will possibly make the signed document bigger than necessary, but a too small one will cause the signing process to fail. The value will be clamped to the nearest even value between 0 and 256 KB (262144 bytes).

By default, Document Engine will set a size of 32 KB (32768 bytes), which should be enough to support even complex certificates.

ℹ️ Note: The estimatedSize corresponds to the /Contents field of the signature field — that is, the signature container. The size of the signature container mostly depends on the complexity of the certificates used for digital signatures.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
object

Represents a digital signature associated with a portion of the document. A signature's status is expressed via two properties:

  • integrity, which guarantees that the content covered by the signature byte-range hasn't changed since the signature has been applied.
  • validity, which guarantees that the entity who applied the signature is who they claim to be.
documentIntegrityStatus
required
string
Enum: "ok" "tampered_document" "failed_to_retrieve_signature_contents" "failed_to_retrieve_byterange" "failed_to_compute_digest" "failed_to_retrieve_signing_certificate" "failed_to_retrieve_public_key" "failed_encryption_padding" "failed_unsupported_signature_type" "general_failure"
certificateChainValidationStatus
required
string
Enum: "ok" "ok_but_self_signed" "ok_but_could_not_check_revocation" "untrusted" "expired" "not_yet_valid" "invalid" "revoked" "failed_to_retrieve_signature_contents" "general_validation_problem"
signatureValidationStatus
required
string
Enum: "valid" "warning" "error"
isTrusted
required
boolean
isSelfSigned
required
boolean
isExpired
required
boolean
documentModifiedSinceSignature
required
boolean
signerName
string
creationDate
string
signatureReason
string
signatureLocation
string
validFrom
string
validUntil
string
type
string
Value: "pspdfkit/signature-info"
signatureFormFQN
string
ltv
boolean
signatureType
string
Enum: "cms" "cades"
Array of objects

An array of digital certificates that form the certificate chain used to validate the signature. It will contain the validated certificate chain if the signature is valid and the certificate chain could be validated. Otherwise, it will contain the certificates that were used to attempt validation.

Callbacks

/api/documents/{documentId}/sign

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
Content type
{
  • "signatureType": "cades",
  • "flatten": false,
  • "appearance": {
    • "mode": "signatureOnly",
    • "contentType": "image/png",
    • "showWatermark": true,
    • "showSignDate": true,
    • "showSigner": true,
    • "showReason": true,
    • "showLocation": true
    },
  • "position": {
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "rect": [
      • 0,
      • 0,
      • 100,
      • 100
      ]
    },
  • "cadesLevel": "b-lt",
  • "signatureContainer": "raw",
  • "signingToken": "user-1-with-rights",
  • "signatureMetadata": {
    • "signerName": "John Appleseed",
    • "signatureReason": "accepted",
    • "signatureLocation": "Vienna"
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "signature": {
      • "signerName": "John Appleseed",
      • "creationDate": "2013-12-19 14:45:26",
      • "signatureReason": "accepted",
      • "signatureLocation": "Vienna",
      • "documentIntegrityStatus": "ok",
      • "certificateChainValidationStatus": "ok",
      • "signatureValidationStatus": "valid",
      • "isTrusted": true,
      • "isSelfSigned": true,
      • "isExpired": true,
      • "documentModifiedSinceSignature": true,
      • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
      • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
      • "type": "pspdfkit/signature-info",
      • "signatureFormFQN": "Signature-a9c0376e-15cd-416f-9b8f-bbf341fae0ca",
      • "ltv": false,
      • "signatureType": "cms",
      • "signingCertificateChain": [
        • {
          • "isCACertificate": false,
          • "isSelfSigned": false,
          • "issuerCommonName": "Example CA",
          • "serialNumberHex": "1234567890ABCDEF",
          • "subjectCommonName": "John Appleseed",
          • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
          • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
          • "type": "pspdfkit/certificate"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
}

Callback payload samples

Callback
Content type
application/json
{
  • "action": "sign_pkcs7",
  • "signature_type": "cades",
  • "digest": "1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef",
  • "hash_algorithm": "sha256",
  • "encoded_contents": "YmFzZSA2NCBlbmNvZGVkIGNvbnRlbnRzIG9mIHRoZSBkb2N1bWVudAo",
  • "signing_token": "custom_signing_token"
}

Refresh signatures on a document

Use this endpoint to refresh LTV signatures for the given document.

Learn more about CAdES and LTV signatures here: https://www.nutrient.io/guides/web/signatures/digital-signatures/standards/#understanding-ltv-pades-b-lt

It will refresh the signatures with IDs provided in the signatureFQNs field. If signatureFQNs is not set, or empty, then all the signatures in the document will be refreshed.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema: application/json
signatureFQNs
Array of strings

An optional list of signature IDs to refresh.

If this list is empty then all the signatures in the document will be refreshed.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object

Represents a digital signature associated with a portion of the document. A signature's status is expressed via two properties:

  • integrity, which guarantees that the content covered by the signature byte-range hasn't changed since the signature has been applied.
  • validity, which guarantees that the entity who applied the signature is who they claim to be.
documentIntegrityStatus
required
string
Enum: "ok" "tampered_document" "failed_to_retrieve_signature_contents" "failed_to_retrieve_byterange" "failed_to_compute_digest" "failed_to_retrieve_signing_certificate" "failed_to_retrieve_public_key" "failed_encryption_padding" "failed_unsupported_signature_type" "general_failure"
certificateChainValidationStatus
required
string
Enum: "ok" "ok_but_self_signed" "ok_but_could_not_check_revocation" "untrusted" "expired" "not_yet_valid" "invalid" "revoked" "failed_to_retrieve_signature_contents" "general_validation_problem"
signatureValidationStatus
required
string
Enum: "valid" "warning" "error"
isTrusted
required
boolean

required

string
ltv
boolean
signatureType

Array of objects

An array of digital certificates that form the certificate chain used to validate the signature. It will contain the validated certificate chain if the signature is valid and the certificate chain could be validated. Otherwise, it will contain the certificates that were used to attempt validation.

/api/documents/{documentId}/refresh_ltv

    ]
}

  • "data": {
    • "signerName": "John Appleseed",
    • "creationDate": "2013-12-19 14:45:26",
    • "signatureReason": "accepted",
    • "signatureLocation": "Vienna",
    • "documentIntegrityStatus": "ok",
    • "certificateChainValidationStatus": "ok",
    • "signatureValidationStatus": "valid",

    • "isSelfSigned": true,
    • "isExpired": true,
    • "documentModifiedSinceSignature": true,
    • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
    • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
    • "type": "pspdfkit/signature-info",
    • "signatureFormFQN": "Signature-a9c0376e-15cd-416f-9b8f-bbf341fae0ca",
    • "ltv": false,
    • "signatureType": "cms",
    • "signingCertificateChain": [
      • {
        • "isCACertificate": false,
        • "isSelfSigned": false,
        • "issuerCommonName": "Example CA",
        • "serialNumberHex": "1234567890ABCDEF",
        • "subjectCommonName": "John Appleseed",
        • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
        • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
        • "type": "pspdfkit/certificate"
        }
      ]
    }
}

Get Digital Signatures

Returns a document's digital signatures.

A document's digital signature status is computed by looking at all the digital signatures included in the document. Digital signature status is automatically updated after each change (e.g. adding a new annotation).

The validity of a signature is determined by the signing certificate used to create it: If you're using a custom certificate, you need to set up Document Engine to use a corresponding certificate store in order to identify the signature as valid. Please check our guide article on how to set up custom certificates for digital signature validation.

By default, the signature certificates are validated against the current time. This means that valid signatures with expired certificates validate as expired. You can modify the DIGITAL_SIGNATURE_CERTIFICATE_CHECK_TIME configuration option to signing_time if you wish to instead validate certificates against the signing time.

⚠ Warning: If you're validating digital signature certificates against the signing time, special care should be taken: By default, there's no way of knowing whether the creation time stored with the signature itself can be trusted. To solve this issue, digital signatures need to use a Time Stamping Authority to provide a signed timestamp to embed. Note that we don't validate the timestamp token's certificates — we always assume a valid proof of existence if it's present. Thus, it's expected that the timestamps will be validated independently by your client code.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object
checkedAt
string <datetime>
documentModifiedSinceSignature
boolean
status
string
Enum: "valid" "warning" "error"
Array of objects
/api/documents/{documentId}/signatures

Request samples

  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:5000/api/documents/{documentId}/signatures \
  --header 'Authorization: Token token=secret' \
  --header 'pspdfkit-pdf-password: password'

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "data": {
    • "checkedAt": "string",
    • "documentModifiedSinceSignature": true,
    • "status": "valid",
    • "signatures": [
      • {
        • "signerName": "John Appleseed",
        • "creationDate": "2013-12-19 14:45:26",
        • "signatureReason": "accepted",
        • "signatureLocation": "Vienna",
        • "documentIntegrityStatus": "ok",
        • "certificateChainValidationStatus": "ok",
        • "signatureValidationStatus": "valid",
        • "isTrusted": true,
        • "isSelfSigned": true,
        • "isExpired": true,
        • "documentModifiedSinceSignature": true,
        • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
        • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
        • "type": "pspdfkit/signature-info",
        • "signatureFormFQN": "Signature-a9c0376e-15cd-416f-9b8f-bbf341fae0ca",
        • "ltv": false,
        • "signatureType": "cms",
        • "signingCertificateChain": [
          • {
            • "isCACertificate": false,
            • "isSelfSigned": false,
            • "issuerCommonName": "Example CA",
            • "serialNumberHex": "1234567890ABCDEF",
            • "subjectCommonName": "John Appleseed",
            • "validFrom": "2023-12-01T15:34:15Z",
            • "validUntil": "2025-11-30T15:34:14Z",
            • "type": "pspdfkit/certificate"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
}

Digitally Sign a Layer

Use this endpoint to digitally sign a document's layer.

You can apply a signature to a specific Instant layer. This lets you maintain independent versions of the same document with separate signatures. For example, if you're working on a contract, you can maintain two layers: one for the original document, and one for a copy that will be digitally signed.

You can sign an Instant layer using the parent document ID and the layer name. If you use a layer name that maps to a non-existing layer, it will be copied automatically from the document base layer and then signed.

Signing Service

The actual signing of the current state of the document is performed by a signing service callback that needs to be maintained and operated separately. It needs to expose a single HTTP endpoint that receives all callbacks required during the document signing flow differentiated by an action property in the request's JSON.

URL of the signing service needs to be configured via SIGNING_SERVICE_URL environment variable.

Watermark and Graphic

The appearance of a digital signature can include a watermark, which is an image typically depicting a company logo or stamp placed in the center, and a graphic, which is an image usually containing the signer's name in the form of a handwritten signature image positioned on the left side of the signature. You can find more information about these different signature appearance options at https://www.nutrient.io/guides/document-engine/signatures/signature-lifecycle/configure-digital-signature-appearance/.

To specify the image to be used as the watermark or graphic in the digital signature, send a multipart request with the application/json part containing the sign request options and the image part containing the watermark image, and the graphicImage part containing the graphic.

path Parameters
documentId
required
string

The document ID

layerName
required
string

The layer name

header Parameters
pspdfkit-pdf-password
string
Default:
Examples:
  • password - Plain-text password
  • base64:Cg== - Base64 encoded password

The PDF document password.

The value can be either either a plain-text password or a base64 encoded password in a form base64:<encoded-password>. Use the Base64 encoding if your password contains characters that are not allowed in HTTP header or would be otherwise mangled (e.g. trailing or leading spaces)

If the document is password protected, any operations performed on it require supplying a password.

Request Body schema:
signatureType
required
string
Default: "cms"
Enum: "cms" "cades"

The signature type to create. Note: While this field is required if sending signature parameters, the entire data object itself is optional in the multipart request.

flatten
boolean
Default: false

Controls whether to flatten the document before signing it. This is useful when you want the document's appearance to remain stable before signing and to ensure there's no indication that the document can be edited after signing.

Note that the resulting document's records (annotations and form fields) will be deleted.

formFieldName
string

Name of the signature form field to sign. Use this when signing an existing signature form field. If a signature field with this name does not exist in the document, it will be created at the position specified with position.

If a signature field with the specified name exists and position is also set, the request will result in an error.

Note: Either formFieldName or position must be provided if creating a visible signature.

object

The appearance settings for the visible signature. Omit if you want an invisible signature to be created.

object

Position of the visible signature form field. Omit if you want an invisible signature or if you specified the formFieldName option.

object

Optional metadata that describes the digital signature and becomes part of the signature itself. This information will be shown by PDF readers to end users and can be included in the visual appearance of the signature if you opted for a visible signature and enabled the necessary options in appearance.

cadesLevel
string
Default: "b-lt"
Enum: "b-lt" "b-t" "b-b"

The CAdES level to use when creating the signature. The default value is CAdES B-LT. This parameter is ignored when the signatureType is cms.

This is more like a hint of what level to use, and you should be aware that the API can return b-b even when you ask for b-lt. This can happen when the timestamp authority server is down, etc.

If this API is invoked with the Document Engine, you can override the default with the following environment variable: DIGITAL_SIGNATURE_CADES_LEVEL.

For Long-Term Validation (LTV) of the signature - when this API is invoked with the Document Engine - you need to ensure that the signing certificate chain links to a trusted anchor Certificate Authority (CA) at the time of signing.

To add the root CA and necessary intermediate CAs to your Document Engine instance, follow the instructions in our guide on Providing Trusted Root Certificates.

signatureContainer
string
Enum: "pkcs7" "raw"

Controls the signature container that will be requested from the signing service:

  • pkcs7 - signing service is expected to return PKCS#7 container with signed data.
  • raw - signing service is expected to return RSA signed data directly. Expects PKCS#1 v1.5 signed data.

The default value is pkcs7.

hashAlgorithm
string
Enum: "md5" "sha160" "sha224" "sha256" "sha384" "sha512"

The hash algorithm to use when computing the digest of the document.

The default value is sha256. It is recommended to use sha256 or better.

certificates
Array of strings

A set of base64-encoded X.509 certificates that will be used to sign the document.

Required for raw signature container or cades signature type. If not provided, will be requested from the signing service.

signingToken
string

A string token that will be forwarded to the underlying signing service.

estimatedSize
integer >= 0

Estimated size of the signature (in bytes). The estimated size is the size for the signature that will be reserved in the PDF document before digitally signing it.

A big estimated size will possibly make the signed document bigger than necessary, but a too small one will cause the signing process to fail. The value will be clamped to the nearest even value between 0 and 256 KB (262144 bytes).

By default, Document Engine will set a size of 32 KB (32768 bytes), which should be enough to support even complex certificates.

ℹ️ Note: The estimatedSize corresponds to the /Contents field of the signature field — that is, the signature container. The size of the signature container mostly depends on the complexity of the certificates used for digital signatures.

Responses

Response Schema: application/json
object

Represents a digital signature associated with a portion of the document. A signature's status is expressed via two properties:

  • integrity, which guarantees that the content covered by the signature byte-range hasn't changed since the signature has been applied.
  • validity, which guarantees that the entity who applied the signature is who they claim to be.
documentIntegrityStatus
required
string
Enum: "ok" "tampered_document" "failed_to_retrieve_signature_contents" "failed_to_retrieve_byterange" "failed_to_compute_digest" "failed_to_retrieve_signing_certificate" "failed_to_retrieve_public_key" "failed_encryption_padding" "failed_unsupported_signature_type" "general_failure"
certificateChainValidationStatus
required
string
Enum: "ok" "ok_but_self_signed" "ok_but_could_not_check_revocation" "untrusted" "expired" "not_yet_valid" "invalid" "revoked" "failed_to_retrieve_signature_contents" "general_validation_problem"
signatureValidationStatus
required
string
Enum: "valid" "warning" "error"
isTrusted
required
boolean
isSelfSigned
required
boolean
isExpired
required
boolean
documentModifiedSinceSignature
required
boolean
signerName
string
creationDate
string
signatureReason
string
signatureLocation
string
validFrom
string
validUntil
string
type
string
Value: "pspdfkit/signature-info"
signatureFormFQN
string
ltv
boolean
signatureType
string
Enum: "cms" "cades"
Array of objects

An array of digital certificates that form the certificate chain used to validate the signature. It will contain the validated certificate chain if the signature is valid and the certificate chain could be validated. Otherwise, it will contain the certificates that were used to attempt validation.

Callbacks

/api/documents/{documentId}/layers/{layerName}/sign

Request samples

  • Payload
  • cURL
  • Node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • Python

{
  • "signatureType": "cades",
  • "flatten": false,
  • "appearance": {
    • "mode": "signatureOnly",
    • "contentType": "image/png",
    • "showWatermark": true,
    • "showSignDate": true,
    • "showSigner": true,
    • "showReason": true,
    • "showLocation": true
    },
  • "position": {
    • "pageIndex": 0,
    • "rect": [
      • 0,
      • 0,
      • 100,
      • 100
      ]
    },
  • "cadesLevel": "b-lt",
  • "signatureContainer": "raw",
  • "signingToken": "user-1-with-rights",
  • "signatureMetadata": {
    • "signerName": "John Appleseed",
    • "signatureReason": "accepted",
    • "signatureLocation": "Vienna"
    }
